ElectionsCitizen ReporterVideosPhotosWeatherPollution NewsEventsNewsCity NewsDelhi NewsDigital idea from New York to \xe2\x80\x98link\xe2\x80\x99 up DelhiThis story is from June 27, 2018Digital idea from New York to \xe2\x80\x98link\xe2\x80\x99 up DelhiMayank Manohar | TNN | Updated: Jun 27, 2018, 1:31 ISTPicture for representational purpose only.NEW DELHI: Taking a cue from New York City\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Link NYC\xe2\x80\x99 infrastructure project to provide free WiFi services, the New Delhi Municipal Council has installed two \xe2\x80\x98NDMC Link\xe2\x80\x99 digital interactive panel at Connaught Place, as a part of NDMC\xe2\x80\x99s smart city project to provide better services to people. The 9ft-panel will have features including 46-inch interactive panel to give access to all government department sites, railways, airlines, wayfinder, maps, bus services, NDMC services, tourist spots, air quality data etc, free WiFi, mobile charging point, sensor and camera to monitor. It also has a 75-inch LED screen for advertisement panel. NDMC has installed one at Palika Bazar entrance and one near Charkha Museum in Connaught Place. NDMC chairman Naresh Kumar told TOI that the council has procured 50 such panels, which will be installed across NDMC areas including Khan Market, Sarojini Nagar, Mandi House, Bengali Market, India Gate, Gole Market, Sansad Marg, Lodhi Colony etc. \xe2\x80\x9cNew York City has implemented this concept and we have taken a cue from them to provide free WiFi services along with an interactive panel to avail government services. We have selected locations with high footfall and market places where these panels will be installed,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kumar. \xe2\x80\x9cLink NYC panels have two 55-inch screens, one for advertisement and one interactive panel, which we have modified as 75-inch advertisement panel and 46-inch interactive panel. In the second phase, if the project is successful and well received by the public, we might increase the number of panels from 50 to 75,\xe2\x80\x9d added Kumar. \xe2\x80\x9cThe transaction facility will not be available as of now due to security issues. We are exploring possibilities for improving the services provided by these panels,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. For reprint rights: Times Syndication Service', b'From New York To New Delhi: NDMC Installs Free WiFi Kiosks To Link The Capital\nX\nSORRY, No RESULTS FOUND\nLOAD MORE\nNews\nEnglish\n\xe0\xa4\xb9\xe0\xa4\xbf\xe0\xa4\x82\xe0\xa4\xa6\xe0\xa5\x80\nnotification\nhi,\nmy_dashboard profile_setting logout\nSIGN IN / SIGN UP\nHome india world sports weird\n#INDIAONAPLATE\nFrom New York To New Delhi: NDMC Installs Free WiFi Kiosks To Link The Capital\n189 SHARES\nHome\n#ITCounts\nNews\nindia\nworld\nsports\nweird\nTechnology\nNews\nApps\nScience And Future\nUrban Mobility\nCurrent\nElectric\nAlternate\nLifestyle\nself\nstyle\nwho we are\ntravel\nfood\nEntertainment\nbollywood\ncelebscoop\nhollywood\nTrending\nHuman Interest\nWTF\nSocial Relevance\nJugaad\nEnvironment\nHealth\nHealthy Living\nRecipes\nInspire\nTips & Tricks\nBuzz\nSports\nVideos\nPhotogallery\n#INDIAONAPLATE\nHome\n>\nNews\n>\nindia\n>\nFrom New York To New Delhi: NDMC Installs Free WiFi Kiosks To Link The Capital\nFrom New York To New Delhi: NDMC Installs Free WiFi Kiosks To Link The Capital\nKriti Gupta\nUpdated: Jun 28, 2018, 11:49 IST\n189 SHARES\nFACEBOOK\nTWITTER\nREDDIT\nSAVE\n"Free super fast WiFi and that\'s just the beginning", this phrase pops up on your screen the moment you open New York City\'s international infrastructure project website, \'Link NYC\'. Initiated in 2014 this project aims to connect several cities with free internet connectivity. \'Link Kiosks\' in New York were set up to reduce dependency on payphones and other wired systems.\xc2\xa0 However, free super fast WiFi is also speeding its way to India as the New Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) has taken up a similar digital project that would link up Delhi with free WiFi availability.\xc2\xa0 NDMC has installed two \'Link Kiosks\' in New Delhi\'s financial and business hub, Connaught Place under its smart city project. One at Palika Bazar entrance and one near Charkha Museum. C.P witnesses a large turnout of customers, traders and businessmen. People have often complained of low internet connectivity at the shopping hub which also forms an integral part of India\'s historical architecture. With the rapid growth of Delhi Metro Railway Corporation (DMRC),commuters exiting adjoining stations like Rajiv Chowk, Mandi House, Janpath will also benefit from NDMC\'s \'Link Delhi\' project.\nKey Features\xc2\xa0 The Kiosk will have two screens, while one will cater to the advertising needs, the other will be used for interaction. New York currently has two 55-inch screens which NDMC has modified to a 75 inch advertisement panel and a 46 inch interactive panel, said NDMC chairman Naresh Kumar to TOI.\xc2\xa0 Don\'t Miss\nStarving & Exhausted Polar Bear Wanders Into Industrial Siberian Town, 1,500 Kms Away From Home\n18K SHARES\nOver 100 Children Dead: Bihar Health Minister Talks Cricket While PM Tweets Yoga\n22.3K SHARES\nWorld\'s Largest Slum, Dharavi, Beats Taj Mahal And Emerges As Favourite Place For Travellers...\n2.9K SHARES\n64% Indians Don\xe2\x80\x99t Want Refugees, Is Compassion Missing In The Land Of Buddha?\n4.3K SHARES\nPeople Refused To Help This Mother Get Her Encephalitis Battling Kid To Hospital, Till This...\n3.3K SHARES\nThe interactive panel will provide access to to all government department sites, railways, airlines, wayfinder, maps, bus services, NDMC services, tourist spots, air quality data etc, free WiFi, mobile charging point, sensor and camera to monitor.\nThe Corporation has an objective of installing 50 such kiosks in popular visitors\' spots like Khan Market, Sarojini Nagar, Lodhi Colony, India Gate etc. If the initiative is successful then the number of panels will be increased from 50 to 75 in the next phase.\xc2\xa0 "New York City has implemented this concept and we have taken a cue from them to provide free WiFi services along with an interactive panel to avail government services. We have selected locations with high footfall and market places where these panels will be installed,\xe2\x80\x9d Kumar told TOI. However, the users will not be able to avail transaction facilities for the time being, due to security issues.\xc2\xa0 If NDMC\'s project to link Delhi with free WiFi succeeds then general public shall be able to call for help during emergency through these panels. They will be able to make free calls, charge their devices and view public service announcements on advertising screens.\nFACEBOOK\nTWITTER\nREDDIT\nSAVE\n189 SHARES\nPromoted Stories AD: MilaapThis Powered by Indiatimes Lifestyle Network. All rights reserved', b'\'NDMC Link\': From free WiFi to Wayfinder, here\'s what these New York-style digital panels have to offer - The Financial Express\nHomeBudget 2019MarketsStocksEconomyAutoIndustryMoneyIndiaInfraOpinion\xe2\x80\x98NDMC Link\xe2\x80\x99: From free WiFi to Wayfinder, here\xe2\x80\x99s what these New York-style digital panels have to\xc2\xa0offerBy: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: June 27, 2018 12:03:10 PMTaken from \xe2\x80\x98Link NYC\xe2\x80\x99 concept in New York City, NDMC\'s new service is part of its mega-budget smart city project. You will come across two such screens at Connaught Place- one at Palika Bazar and another near Charkha Museum. You will come across two such screens at Connaught Place- one at Palika Bazar and another near Charkha Museum.With an aim to provide all-round information pertaining to the national capital, the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has come up with \xe2\x80\x98NDMC Link\xe2\x80\x99 digital interactive panels which comprises all government department sites and information regarding railways, airlines, wayfinder, maps, bus services, NDMC services, tourist spots and air quality data.Taken from \xe2\x80\x98Link NYC\xe2\x80\x99 concept in New York City, NDMC\xe2\x80\x99s new service is part of its mega-budget smart city project. You will come across two such screens at Connaught Place- one at Palika Bazar and another near Charkha Museum. NDMC chairman Naresh Kumar said that the motive behind installing such panels was to provide free WiFi services and accsess to important government services, Times Of India reported.Apart from information and access to key websites, salient features of this panel include a mobile charging point, sensor and camera along with free WiFi. The height of the panel is 9ft and it has a 46-inch interactive panel. NDMC has also kept the business part in mind as the panel also has 75-inch LED screen for advertisement. While the process of installing of the panel has just begun , the civic body will come up more such panels with several other attractive features.As per the plan, the panels will soon be seen in Sansad Marg, Lodhi Colony, Khan Market, Sarojini Nagar, Mandi House, Bengali Market, India Gate and Gole Market.Earlier, Kumar had asserted that the NDMC\xe2\x80\x99s smart city projects will be completed before the 2020 deadline. The NDMC also said that it has set up solar panels with 3.30 MW of power generation capacity on building roofs. Of the Rs 1,800 crore Smart City Plan of the civic body, work on a range of major projects began in phases by October last year, according to reports.These projects include setting up of a unified command and control centre, multi-level parking at Khan Market, public bike sharing, sewage treatment plants, redesign of 13 roads totalling 31 kms, including seven leading to Connaught Place. Implementation of other projects will begin by March next year. These include India Investment Centre at Yashwant Place, Shivaji Terminal Transport Hub, World Class Skill Centre at Moti Bagh and Paryatan Bhawan.Follow financialexpress.com for all news and analysis on the Lok Sabha Elections 2019. TV\nHindi\nGujarati\nAll Stocks\nApp\nSubscriptions\nSpecials\nFeedback\nyou are here: HomeNewsIndia\nLast Updated : Jun 27, 2018 06:17 PM IST\n| Source: Moneycontrol.com\nThis is how NDMC is planning to make free wi-fi available across New Delhi\nIt is part of the ongoing smart city project of providing better services to the people.\nMoneycontrol News\n@moneycontrolcom\nInspired by New York City\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Link NYC\xe2\x80\x99 infrastructure project to offer free wi-fi services, the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has installed and set up two \xe2\x80\x98NDMC Link\xe2\x80\x99 digital interactive panels at Connaught Place. It is part of the ongoing smart city project of providing better services to the people.As per a report\xc2\xa0in The Times of India, the New Delhi Municipal Council has installed one panel at Palika Bazaar entrance and the other near Charkha Museum in Connaught Place. NDMC chairman Naresh Kumar said, \xe2\x80\x9cNew York city has implemented this concept and we have taken a cue from them to provide free wi-fi services along with an interactive panel to avail government services. We have selected locations with high footfall and marketplaces where these panels will be installed.\xe2\x80\x9dHe also added that the council has procured 50 such panels, which will be installed across NDMC areas including Khan Market, Sarojini Nagar, Mandi House, Bengali Market, India Gate, Gole Market, Sansad Marg, Lodhi Colony, etc.Close\nThe 9-ft tall installed panel will include a 46-inch interactive panel to give access to all government department sites, railways, airlines, Wayfinder, maps, bus services, NDMC services, tourist spots, air quality data etc, free WiFi, mobile charging point, sensor and camera to monitor. And also has a 75-inch LED screen is to be used as an advertising panel.\nrelated news\nIndia expresses concern over rising oil prices following developments in Strait of Hormuz\nNiti Aayog asks 2-, 3-wheeler makers to present EV conversion plan in 2 weeks\nFire breaks out at under-construction Navy warship \xc2\xa0Subscribe to Moneycontrol Pro and gain access to curated markets data, exclusive trading recommendations, independent equity analysis, actionable investment ideas, nuanced takes on macro, corporate and policy actions, practical insights from market gurus and much more.\nFirst Published on Jun 27, 2018 06:17 pm\ntags\n#India\n#NDMC\n#New Delhi\n#New York\n#Trending News\n#US\nmost popular\nAnalysts bet on these 8 stocks for 9-16% return in short term\n10 most congested cities in the world: Guess which Indian city takes top spot?\nThese CEOs and top execs pocketed the highest salaries in 2018\n3-Point Analysis | No plan to cap H-1B visas: US\nKia finally unveils first car in India\nArrests in IL&FS case an important milestone\nCheck lesser-known World Cup records here\nMust Listen\nThe Market Podcast | Investors nervous as rains delayed; budget 2019 outlook bleak\nstay updated\nSubscribe to our Daily Newsletter\nsubmit\nGet Daily News on your Browser\nEnable\nTrending news\nSamsung Galaxy M40 vs Motorola One Vision: Which one is a better smartphone?\nOppo to unveil a prototype smartphone with a camera under the screen\nLooking to buy a gaming monitor? Reproduction of news articles, photos, videos or any other content in whole or in part in any form or medium without express writtern permission of moneycontrol.com is prohibited.\nPankaj Thuain\nOpen in App", b'Creepy Mister Softee LinkNYC Jingle Nightmare Enters Month Three - Gothamist\nmenu content begins\nGothamist\nDonate\nNews\nArts & Entertainment\nFood\nPopular\nFollow Us\nFacebook\nTwitter\nInstagram\nYouTube\nAdvertising\nContact Us\nNewsletter\nRSS Feed\nStaff\nSearch this site\nSearch\nSearch\nSend us a Story Idea\nNYPR\nView All Brands\nCaret Down\n\xc2\xa9 2019 New York Public Radio. All rights reserved.\nTerms of Use\nPrivacy Policy\nmenu content ends\nMenu\nGothamist\nNews\nArts & Entertainment\nFood\nPopular\nDonate\nSearch\nSearch this site\nClose\nSearch\nSearch\nArts & Entertainment\nCreepy Mister Softee LinkNYC Jingle Nightmare Enters Month Three\nBy\nBen Yakas\nJuly 2, 2018 12:30 p.m.\nFacebook\nTwitter\nReddit\nEmail\nIn May, several readers noticed that a creepy-as-hell, slowed down version of the Mister Softee jingle had been playing through some LinkNYC kiosks around the city, as if Pennywise had chosen the form of a silver data harvester rather than a red balloon.\nLinkNYC said it was the result of "an old fashioned phone prank," adding that it would reboot the malfunctioning tablets. But it\'s now July, and guess what? The jingle is still popping up and creeping out New Yorkers. So what aren\'t we being told about this ice cream mirage?\n@gothamist it\xe2\x80\x99s happening again\xe2\x80\x94 chelsea adelaine hassler (@chelseaadelaine) July 2, 2018\nthis one\xe2\x80\x99s from down the street yesterday pic.twitter.com/5qReXIZN4y\xe2\x80\x94 chelsea adelaine hassler (@chelseaadelaine) July 2, 2018\nMultiple people have reported hearing the demonic jingle emanating from kiosks around Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens over the last month, prompting concerns that a supervillain might be hacking the kiosks during heatwaves in order to lull New Yorkers into a false sense of auditory somnolence. You can see/hear a few more examples below.\nSpooky Mr Softee kiosk is back! pic.twitter.com/ggM0dp0Sp4\xe2\x80\x94 Alex Cannon (@tehevilcannon) June 22, 2018\n@LinkNYC several of your kiosks are playing the creepily slow Mr. Softee jingle again. 53rd and 54th streets and 3rd Ave.\xe2\x80\x94 Doug Allen (@DFAllenIII) June 29, 2018\nFollow up: It is happening again. The @LinkNYC stations are playing the Mr. Softee theme song. WHO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS MADNESS? pic.twitter.com/nIXs0J4toz\xe2\x80\x94 Megan (@megan_musings) June 2, 2018\n30 ave 31 Street Astoria kiosk playing Mr. Softee jingle? pic.twitter.com/9PfD2xAW2C\xe2\x80\x94 Joan P (@JPovol) June 14, 2018\nSo we have a lot of questions: is someone "hacking" each individual kiosk each time? Or are there multiple copycats hacking multiple kiosks? Did one person come up with the hack and now it is spreading from kiosk to kiosk like a virus in the first act of any half-decent zombie movie? Is it a protest by anti-surveillance activists against data companies encroaching upon our streets? Or is this the kind of prank that can only be cured by exorcism? What is LinkNYC not telling us? And even more pressing: what is LinkNYC not not telling us?\nHi Jacob! As we mentioned previously, LinkNYC wasn\'t hacked. It was an old-fashioned phone prank\xe2\x80\x94 LinkNYC (@LinkNYC) June 26, 2018\nWhat do Celebrities\xe2\x84\xa2 Zach Braff & Josh Groban know? What do they not know? How deep does this conspiracy run?\nMr. Softee would haunt your dreams (more than usual)\xe2\x80\x94 josh groban (@joshgroban) July 1, 2018\nDare we ask: does the conspiracy go even higher up the chain of command straight to the White House? Follow the money, follow the jingle, find the clown.\nI\xe2\x80\x99m high as shit & just realized that Trump is Mister Softee pic.twitter.com/aQKQedWNQg\xe2\x80\x94 z (@iwasdivine) June 26, 2018\nIt could be worse of course. Every kiosk could suddenly switch into "seizure mode."\n@LinkNYC_Support these screens are about to give someone a seizure - Jackson & 44 Dr, LIC pic.twitter.com/ro22ar406F\xe2\x80\x94 corrine rhymes with bean (@corrine) June 26, 2018\n#conspiracies\n#ice cream\n#jingle\n#linknyc\n#midtown\n#mister softee\nDo you know the scoop? \xc2\xa0 Comment below or Send us a Tip\nFeatured in Arts & Entertainment\nRead More In:\nNews\nArts & Entertainment\nFood\nPopular\nDashed Arrow\nBack to Top\nGothamist\nSend Us a Story Idea\nFollow Us\nFacebook\nTwitter\nInstagram\nYouTube\nGothamist is a website about New York City news, arts and events, and food, brought to you by New York Public Radio.\nAdvertising\nContact Us\nNewsletter\nRSS Feed\nStaff\nParty Confetti\nDashed Arrow\nSign up for our newsletter! All rights reserved.\nTerms of Use\nPrivacy Policy', b"Pranksters Are Making LinkNYC Booths Play Ice Cream Van Music - VICE\nVICEVICE NewsVICELANDI-DBroadlyUnited StatesenVideoPodcastsNewsTechMusicFoodHealthMoneyDrugsIdentityGamesEntertainmentEnvironmentTravelHoroscopesSexMore|by Joseph Cox|Jul 3 2018, 3:05pmPranksters Are Making LinkNYC Booths Play Ice Cream Van MusicLinkNYC's Wi-Fi and communication booths are taunting New Yorkers during a heatwave thanks to a clever prankster.SHARETWEETby Joseph Cox|Jul 3 2018, 3:05pmImage: ShutterstockSHARETWEETNew York City is insanely hot right now, which makes a recent prank even more cruel, or ingenious, depending on your perspective. Someone is going around New York, fiddling with the city\xe2\x80\x99s public LinkNYC internet booths, and making them blare out ice cream van music according to social media posts and LinkNYC. \xe2\x80\x9cSomeone hacked the internet kiosk in front of my apartment and it\xe2\x80\x99s been playing the ice cream truck song for hours,\xe2\x80\x9d Chelsea Hassler, vice president and editorial director at communications agency Zeno Group, tweeted on Monday. LinkNYC confirmed the incident to Motherboard, but noted that it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a hack in a technical sense.Instead, LinkNYC told Motherboard in an email, people are using a booth\xe2\x80\x99s phone app to call a number\xe2\x80\x94where the person on the other end presumably plays their ice cream van music of choice\xe2\x80\x94and then pressing the home button on the booth to hide the call in progress.Got a tip? You can contact this reporter securely on Signal on +44 20 8133 5190, OTR chat on jfcox@jabber.ccc.de, or email joseph.cox@vice.com.LinkNYC has installed over a thousand of its booths across New York, which offer free Wi-Fi and other communication services. Critics have pointed to these devices\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x99s potential for snooping because they include, with cameras and Bbluetooth beacons. Notably, LinkNYC added that it has deployed a feature that disables a call after 10 minutes if callers don\xe2\x80\x99t confirm they are present and using the booth. So, if the booths have been blasting out the music for hours as reported, perhaps someone is walking up and down New York making sure the devices don\xe2\x80\x99t hang up. Hassler added in another tweet that several booths were affected. LinkNYC told Motherboard that free access to its services does not mean that everyone is going to use the booths responsibly.SHARETWEETTagged:techMotherboardIce CreamNew kiosks play ice cream truck tunes\nEngadget\nLogin\nHome\nGear\nGaming\nEntertainment\nTomorrow\nBuyer's Guide\n2019 Camera Guide\nParenting and Tech\nBest of CES 2019\nPhones\nLaptops\nView easy target for spoofing attacks\n1h ago\nView\nA new tool detects deepfakes with 96 percent accuracy\n1h ago\nView\nNew York Senate passes ban on Elon Musk's Not-A-Flamethrower\n2h ago\nView\nImage credit: John Taggart/Bloomberg via Getty Images\nsave\nSave\nshare\nCruel pranksters made NYC internet kiosks play ice cream truck tunes\nIt's deliciously evil.\nJon Fingas, @jonfingas\n07.03.18\nin Internet\nComments\n600\nShares\nShare\nTweet\nShare\nSave\nSponsored Links\nJohn Taggart/Bloomberg via Getty Images\nNew York City is in the midst of a heatwave, and some pranksters are taking advantage of technology to twist the knife a little more.\nLinkNYC has confirmed to Motherboard that someone is making its internet kiosks play ice cream truck music, taunting hapless New Yorkers looking for a cold treat on a hot day.\nIt's incredibly cruel (or wonderfuly clever, if you're the mischievous sort), but there's no hacking involved.\nThe perpetrators phone a kiosk, play the mouthwatering tunes from their phone, and switch to the kiosk's home screen to hide that there's a call in progress.\nThere aren't any known suspects, but whoever it is may have accomplices.\nThe pranks have lasted for hours at a time, but kiosks automatically end calls after 10 minutes if you don't confirm that you're present.\nIn other words, someone nearby may be keeping the calls alive by surreptitiously confirming that non-existent presence and walking off.It's not certain what LinkNYC or the city can do, especially when the heat is expected to break (if only just) within a few days.\nIt's entirely likely that the culprits will get away with their dessert-themed devilry, and LinkNYC can't guarantee that every caller is on the up-and-up.\nFor now, you'll just have to be wary about chasing down treats in the Big Apple -- you might want to order from the comfort of home instead.this one's from down the street yesterday pic.twitter.com/5qReXIZN4y\xe2\x80\x94 chelsea adelaine hassler (@chelseaadelaine) July 2, 2018\nSource:\nMotherboard\nIn this All rights reserved.\nAbout Verizon Media\nReprints and Permissions\nSuggestions\nPrivacy Policy (Updated)\nTerms of Service (Updated)\nTrademarks\nAdvertise\nPage 1Page 1ear iconeye iconFill 23text filevr", b'NYC\xe2\x80\x99s Internet Kiosks \xe2\x80\x98Hacked\xe2\x80\x99 To Play Ice Cream Truck Music\nHomeTutorialsReviewsFeature ArticlesPhonesBest Phones CamerasAndroidiPhoneComputersLaptopsEventsAudioGadgetsGamingGeneralPhoto/VideoWebUbergizmo WorldwideUbergizmo in JapaneseUbergizmo in FrenchUbergizmo in GermanUbergizmo in ItalianUbergizmo in SpanishTurn ON NotificationsTurn OFF NotificationsAboutContact\nReviews Phones\nBest Phones CamerasAndroidiPhoneApps Computers\nLaptopsTabletsWindowsTutorialsEventsGadgetsGamingGeneralPhoto/VideoMore\nFeature ArticlesAudioDesign/ConceptsWebUbergizmo in JapaneseUbergizmo in FrenchUbergizmo in GermanUbergizmo in ItalianUbergizmo in SpanishTurn ON NotificationsTurn OFF Notifications NYC\xe2\x80\x99s Internet Kiosks \xe2\x80\x98Hacked\xe2\x80\x99 To Play Ice Cream Truck Music By\nTyler Lee on 07/03/2018 16:43 PDT\nOver the years we\xe2\x80\x99ve come to associate sounds with all kinds of events, for example even non-iPhone users can tell it\xe2\x80\x99s an iPhone based on alert sound when a text message arrives or when the phone is ringing. The same can be said for music played from ice cream trucks, in which it is a sound recognized by many of all ages across many generations.AdvertisingUnfortunately over in NYC, it seems that a cruel prankster has decided to hack the city\xe2\x80\x99s LinkNYC internet booths by making them play ice cream van music. In a report from Motherboard, LinkNYC has confirmed that this is happening, although they noted that this wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really a \xe2\x80\x9chack\xe2\x80\x9d to begin with. Apparently people are using the booth\xe2\x80\x99s phone app to call a number, and that person will then play ice cream van music and hide the call in progress so that on first glance, it will be hard to figure out what\xe2\x80\x99s going on.Given that the city is experiencing a heat wave we can only imagine how frustrating it must be for some who think that the ice cream truck is nearby, only to find out that it isn\xe2\x80\x99t, plus we can imagine how annoying it must be too. According to a tweet by Chelsea Hassler, vice president and editorial director at communications agency Zeno Group, \xe2\x80\x9cSomeone hacked the internet kiosk in front of my apartment and it\xe2\x80\x99s been playing the ice cream truck song for hours.\xe2\x80\x9d\nFiled in General. Intel\nPrune Chef Took Over Spotted Pig Because She\xe2\x80\x99s Jealous of April Bloomfield, Critic Claims\nNew,\n6\ncomments\nPlus, Tribeca Japanese izakaya Zutto will reopen \xe2\x80\x94 and more intel\nby\nStefanie Tuder@stefanietuder\nJul\n3, 2018,\n9:52am EDT\nShare\nTweet\nShare\nShare\nPrune Chef Took Over Spotted Pig Because She\xe2\x80\x99s Jealous of April Bloomfield, Critic Claims\ntweet\nshare\nPocket\nFlipboard\nEmail\nGabrielle Hamilton\nPhoto by Daniel Zuchnik/Getty Images for NYCWFF\nThe Post blames jealousy for Gabrielle Hamilton\xe2\x80\x99s partnership at the Spotted Pig\nApparently the Post thinks it\xe2\x80\x99s a lesbian cat fight that led Prune chef Gabrielle Hamilton to partner with Ken Friedman at the Spotted Pig following allegations of sexual misconduct against him. According to an unnamed source in an incredibly reductive story in the Post, Hamilton \xe2\x80\x9cwas jealous of April [Bloomfield], who\xe2\x80\x99s also openly lesbian and even more famous as a chef than Gabrielle.\xe2\x80\x9d Critic Steve Cuozzo purports that Hamilton is doing this to compete with formed Spotted Pig chef Bloomfield, since she has \xe2\x80\x9calways seemed quietly resentful of her\xe2\x80\x9d and her \xe2\x80\x9cgrowing stable\xe2\x80\x9d of restaurants, while Hamilton has just Prune. Though the move may not make sense to many, this is the most reaching explanation yet.\nThe first Bronx Night Market was a rousing success\nThe first Bronx Night Market took place this past Saturday, with more than 40 food vendors at Fordham Plaza, and it was an undeniable success: More than 10,000 people showed up to eat food from vendors like City Tamale, Empanology, Triple Panna Ice Cream, and MP Fish Fry & Soul, alongside DJ\xe2\x80\x99s and Bronx-based artists and merchants. The next one takes place on July 28.\nOpenings, closings, and coming attractions\nLower East Side fast-casual wrap bar Wolfnights has added a location at 235 Bleecker St. Further downtown, Tribeca burger joint Zaitzeff is now closed. But some positive news is that recently closed Tribeca Japanese bistro Zutto will reopen, it announced on Instagram.\nChipotle tries to quench its limitless thirst with free booze\nIn its latest bid for relevancy, Mexican fast-casual chain Chipotle is giving away half-priced margaritas, beers, canned wine or cocktails with the purchase of a full-priced entr\xc3\xa9e or side in NYC. It\xe2\x80\x99s happening after 3 p.m. on Thursdays in July and August at participating locations.\nLinkNYC machines are going rogue with Mister Softee jingles\nThose phone charging and calling stations scattered around NYC are giving people the creeps. That\xe2\x80\x99s because the LinkNYC machines are playing a slowed-down version of the Mister Softee jingle at random. People are documenting the spooky phenomenon, which has apparently been happening for about three months now, all over social media.\nthis one\xe2\x80\x99s from down the street yesterday pic.twitter.com/5qReXIZN4y\xe2\x80\x94 chelsea adelaine hassler (@chelseaadelaine) July 2, 2018\nSign up for the\nnewsletter\nEater NY\nSign up for our newsletter.\nEmail (required)\nSubscribe\nBy signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy and European users agree to the data transfer policy.\nFoursquare\nThe Spotted Pig\n314 West 11th Street, Manhattan, NY 10014\n(212) 620-0393\nVisit Website\nMore From\nEater NY\nBed-Stuy Gains a Mediterranean Wine Bar Serving Lesser-Seen Wines in NYC\nA Pok\xc3\xa9mon-Inspired Burger Bar Is Headed to Williamsburg\nThe Village Loses Two Neighborhood Restaurants \xe2\x80\x94 and More Closings\n5 Restaurants to Try This Weekend in NYC\nSeafood Charmer the Mermaid Inn Will Open Fourth Location in Chelsea\nCritically Acclaimed Queens Thai Hit Opens in Chelsea Market Today\nMost Read\nThe Village Loses Two Neighborhood Restaurants \xe2\x80\x94 and More Closings\nA weekly updated roundup of shutters throughout New York City\n5 Restaurants to Try This Weekend in NYC\nWeekly inspiration for last-minute dining\nA Pok\xc3\xa9mon-Inspired Burger Bar Is Headed to Williamsburg\nPlus, Tel Aviv import HaSalon gets a visit from the New Yorker \xe2\x80\x94 and more intel\nSign up for the\nnewsletter\nEater NY\nSign up for our newsletter.\nEmail (required)\nSubscribe\nBy signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy and European users agree to the data transfer policy.\nThis Article has a component height of 14. You can unsubscribe at any time.\nFacebook\nTwitter\nEmail\nPrint\nCity mulls wage floor for Uber drivers, or does it? \xe2\x80\x94 SCHUMER a no-show at town hall \xe2\x80\x94 GJONAJ\xe2\x80\x99s trash bill conflicts\xe2\x80\x94 GOTTFRIED the senior statesman\n07/03/2018 07:24 AM EDT\nPresented by PhRMA\nBy Jimmy Vielkind in Albany and Laura Nahmias in Manhattan, with Daniel Lippman\xe2\x80\x9cThank God there has not been harm done to any child because of the mistakes that have been made,\xe2\x80\x9d Mayor Bill de Blasio said in November about the possibility of children in New York City\xe2\x80\x99s public housing being poisoned by lead paint. It\xe2\x80\x99s probably a statement he regrets making so definitively, after the Daily News reported that more than 820 children under age 5 (plus 40 more identified since yesterday) tested positive for elevated lead levels in their blood since the year 2012. Just 19 cases had previously been disclosed, and the city\xe2\x80\x99s health department had only informed the Housing Authority of 68 children with elevated blood lead levels tested between 2010 to 2015.Finding out whether the mayor regrets that November statement, or his thoughts on the previously unreported cases of possible lead poisoning, proved difficult Monday, after the mayor refused to answer questions on the issue at his only public event, before departing on a vacation to Vermont, and then Canada. He took a page from Gov. Andrew Cuomo\xe2\x80\x99s book and chose to address the controversy through a venue he tightly controlled, in a phone interview with a single news outlet, NY1. De Blasio\xe2\x80\x99s top staff have reminded reporters for years that the mayor has a right to some time off, in a job that never really ends. But there were multiple instances Monday in which the administration seemed particularly leaderless on some of the most pressing issues facing the city. On Monday, officials at NYCHA and the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene appeared to have conflicting data and approaches to identifying children with elevated blood levels due to different lead exposure reporting levels used by city agencies, the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, our Amanda Eisenberg reports. City officials weren\xe2\x80\x99t just on separate pages when it came to NYCHA \xe2\x80\x94 they were also very publicly at odds over whether the city plans to mandate a minimum wage for Uber and other ride-hail app drivers, as a spokesman for the mayor undermined one of the mayor\xe2\x80\x99s senior commissioners on the issue on Twitter. A New Yorker profile published Monday revealed, too, that de Blasio has yet to meet with Andy Byford, the man hired to overhaul the city\xe2\x80\x99s subway system nearly eight months ago. The subway system faces a massive capital repair backlog and debilitating structural problems. It\xe2\x80\x99s been a serious source of grievance for all commuting New Yorkers for more than a year. A spokesman for the mayor tweeted yesterday that the mayor has plans to meet Byford on July. After he gets back from vacation.IT\xe2\x80\x99S TUESDAY. Got tips, suggestions or thoughts? Let us know ... WHERE\xe2\x80\x99S ANDREW? Making announcements in the Bronx and on Long Island.WHERE\xe2\x80\x99S BlLL? On vacation.The Tabloids: \xe2\x80\x94 New York Post: \xe2\x80\x9cTHE LOST BOYS\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 Daily News: \xe2\x80\x9cTell THEM to forget the past, Bill\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 See Them \xe2\x80\x94 Newsday: \xe2\x80\x9cNASSAU EMERGENCY FUND HAS $69M DEFICIT\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 El Diario New York: \xe2\x80\x9cEntregue las llaves\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94Translation: \xe2\x80\x9cHand over the keys\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 See ThemThe Free Papers: \xe2\x80\x94 Metro New York: \xe2\x80\x9cPARTY IN THE USA\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 AM New York: \xe2\x80\x9cRED, WHITE & NEW (YORK CITY)\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 See ThemThe Broadsheets:\xe2\x80\x94 New York Times: \xe2\x80\x941 col., above the fold: \xe2\x80\x9cSPEND OR ELSE, PRESIDENT WARNS NATO COUNTRIES\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 1 col., above the fold: \xe2\x80\x9cFacing Revolt, Merkel Allows Border Camps\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 4 col., below the fold: \xe2\x80\x9cNew York City May Become First to Set Pay Floor for Uber Drivers\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 2 col., below the fold: \xe2\x80\x9cLegal Sports Betting Intensifies A Cat-and-Mouse Data Game\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 Wall Street Journal: \xe2\x80\x94 1 col., above the fold: \xe2\x80\x9cMorgan, Goldman Got Help From Fed On Tests\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 3 col., below the fold: \xe2\x80\x9cApp Developers Gain Access To Millions of Gmail Inboxes\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 4 col., above the fold: \xe2\x80\x9cVote Resets U.S., Mexico On Trade\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 See ThemWHAT ALBANY IS READING:\xe2\x80\x94GOTTFRIED STANDS TO MAKE HISTORY \xe2\x80\x94 POLITICO\xe2\x80\x99s Bill Mahoney: There are certain things New Yorkers can count on. They know that rush-hour subway service will be maddeningly slow. They realize that the Mets will lose key players to the disabled list. And they assume that Assemblyman RIchard Gottfried will run for re-election every two years. But while the subways and the Mets are capable of upsetting expectations, in theory anyway, Gottfried has no intention of doing so. He has stood for election in his Hell\xe2\x80\x99s Kitchen and Chelsea-area district 24 times beginning in 1970. And he\'s doing it again this year. Assuming he wins \xe2\x80\x94 that outcome isn\xe2\x80\x99t really in doubt \xe2\x80\x94 and finishes his term, he\xe2\x80\x99ll enter the record books as one of only two legislators in New York history to serve for half a century. (The late John Marchi, who represented Staten Island in the state Senate from Jan. 1, 1957 to Dec. 31, 2006, is the other.) Read more here \xe2\x80\x94TROOPER SHOT \xe2\x80\x94 Elmira Star Gazette\xe2\x80\x99s Jeff Murray and Anthony Borelli: \xe2\x80\x9cA 29-year-old New York state trooper was shot and killed early Monday after responding to a suicidal person barricaded inside his Corning area residence. Trooper Nicholas Clark was among the responders to a 3:30 a.m. 911 call that sent law enforcement to 10041 Welch Road in the Town of Erwin, just south of the City of Corning. During the response, Clark was fatally shot. \xe2\x80\xa6 The suspect, 43-year-old Steven Kiley, was later found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound, Fiore said. Kiley had been listed as principal of Bradford Central School District, but his name and photo were removed from the school\'s website by Monday afternoon.\xe2\x80\x9d Read more here\xe2\x80\x94CONSIDERING THE BUFFALO BILLION \xe2\x80\x94 New York Times\xe2\x80\x99 Jesse McKinley: \xe2\x80\x9cMore than six years ago, Cuomo announced his bold vision for New York\xe2\x80\x99s second largest and perhaps longest-suffering city. \xe2\x80\x98We believe in Buffalo. Let\xe2\x80\x99s put our money where our mouth is,\xe2\x80\x99 Mr. Cuomo said, announcing an economic development package of $1 billion. \xe2\x80\x98That is a big \xe2\x80\x98B\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x94 standing for Buffalo and standing for billion.\xe2\x80\x99 Sure enough, the money soon started to flow to Buffalo, leading to new waterfront parks, gleaming modern factories and a cluster of medical and technology facilities. Mr. Cuomo, a Democrat seeking a third term in November, has repeatedly extolled the plan and the nearly $1.5 billion invested so far, asking for and receiving an additional $500 million last year. But an examination of the plans and progress of projects included in the Buffalo Billion reveals a far more uneven return on investment to date: a mix of street-level successes, expensive brick-and-mortar gambles and ill-conceived misfires.\xe2\x80\x9d Read more here\nA message from PhRMA:\n86% of AARP members support the administration\xe2\x80\x99s proposed rule to reform the rebate system in Medicare Part D, according to a nationwide Morning Consult survey. However, AARP gets $4.5B from health insurance companies and is lobbying against this policy. If their members support this proposed rule, who is AARP really fighting for?\nWHAT CITY HALL IS READING:\xe2\x80\x94TAXI DRIVERS \xe2\x80\x94 After spate of suicides, city looks for ways to address drivers\' mental health , by POLITICO\xe2\x80\x99s Dan Goldberg and Dana Rubinstein: In the weeks before Kenny Chow\xe2\x80\x99s body floated to the surface of the East River by the Brooklyn Bridge, his friend Johnny knew something was wrong. Chow seemed \xe2\x80\x9cunder a lot of stress,\xe2\x80\x9d Johnny said. (He asked that his surname be omitted to protect his children\'s privacy.) "He was complaining about not making his payments, how he\xe2\x80\x99s going down, and constantly working, and so tired,\xe2\x80\x9d Johnny said. Chow, 56, was one of at least six cab-drivers to commit suicide in the last seven months.Five years ago, plans were afoot to establish a \xe2\x80\x9cstress management hotline\xe2\x80\x9d specifically for taxi drivers. The hotline would have been funded through a 6-cent surcharge on each fare. That money would have gone to a fund for a host of services, including the hotline, disability insurance, and assistance for drivers navigating the Affordable Care Act. The surcharge and the benefits it was designed to provide were defeated in court by powerful taxi interests who argued the city lacked the authority to establish it in the first place. Now yellow taxi owner-drivers are in an industry facing gale-force headwinds. The rise of Uber and other app-based services has caused the value of a taxi medallion to plummet, and cab drivers across the city are struggling to come to grips with that new reality. After a spate of suicides \xe2\x80\x94 one very public \xe2\x80\x94 the de Blasio administration is working with drivers to form a new plan, one tailored to their needs. Read more here\xe2\x80\x94ABOUT THAT MINIMUM WAGE \xe2\x80\x94 Report advocating a minimum wage for Uber drivers sparks confusion in de Blasio administration, by POLITICO\'s Dana Rubinstein: Mayor Bill de Blasio\'s administration is weighing a first-in-the-nation minimum wage for drivers who work for apps like Uber, but officials in the administration were publicly at odds Monday about their course of action. In the coming weeks, the city\'s chief taxi regulator had planned to ask for Taxi and Limousine Commission authorization of a $17.22 minimum wage, after expenses, for drivers affiliated with the big four taxi apps in New York City \xe2\x80\x94 Uber, Lyft, Via and June. Together, they provide nearly 600,000 trips a day. But after a TLC-commissioned analysis of its proposal was released Monday, the mayor\'s office hesitated and indicated it wanted the City Council and the mayor\'s office to spearhead some other sort of regulatory effort instead. "Very premature," tweeted de Blasio spokesman Eric Phillips. Read more here. Councilman pushing garbage bill linked to controversial trash hauler \xe2\x80\x94 Crains\xe2\x80\x99s Will Bredderman: \xe2\x80\x9cThe battle over the future of commercial waste carting is getting messy. A politician pushing a bill friendly to the troubled industry has family links to one of its most controversial businesses: Sanitation Salvage, the Bronx-based hauler cited by critics as exemplifying why waste haulers must be reined in. Mayor Bill de Blasio and his allies on the City Council hope to divide the city into zones, where businesses would have to choose from two to five vendors (rather than dozens) to take away their trash. Councilmen Robert Cornegy and Mark Gjonaj have sought to head it off with legislation forbidding the administration from carving out such districts. As it happens, Gjonaj\xe2\x80\x99s brother was until recently in business with the Squitieri family, which owns Sanitation Salvage. State Liquor Authority records show that from 2015 until last month, brothers Steve and John Squitieri each owned a 9% stake in Jemi LLC, which did business at 565 City Island Ave. under a succession of names, including the Lighthouse, Vistamar Restaurant and Don Coqui on the Water. During that period, Paul Gjonaj\xe2\x80\x94who had previously been the limited liability company\'s sole owner\xe2\x80\x94held a 41% share in the entity.\xe2\x80\x9d Read it here \xe2\x80\x9cDead of AIDS and Forgotten in Potter\xe2\x80\x99s Field: In an untold chapter of the AIDS epidemic, scores of unclaimed bodies were buried in a remote spot on Hart Island. How many exactly remains unclear\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94 New York Times\xe2\x80\x99s Corey Kilgannon: \xe2\x80\x9cThe bodies reached Hart Island on a ferry like all the others, in spare wooden boxes and bound for ignominious mass internment off the coast of the Bronx where New York City buries its unclaimed dead by the hundreds in long, shallow trenches. But when these 17 bodies arrived in 1985, the island\xe2\x80\x99s hardened crews, used to burying dozens of indigent people per week, recoiled. These were different. They had died from a widely feared nascent disease called AIDS, a highly contagious illness with a skyrocketing death toll. The bodies were kept out of the trenches and instead quarantined in a remote spot on the island\xe2\x80\x99s southernmost tip, buried deep in individual graves... The island would go on to receive scores, if not hundreds, of people who died during the AIDS epidemic, which during the 1980s and 1990s killed more than 100,000 people in New York, about a quarter of AIDS deaths nationwide during the same period. Trying to pin down the precise number of those with AIDS buried on Hart Island is difficult. A longstanding stigma about the island and criticism that the burial practices are crude and outdated have made city officials reluctant to provide many details. Officials at several city agencies involved in the burials refused interview requests to discuss the issue and insisted that no data or any other information was available on AIDS burials.\xe2\x80\x9d Read it here \xe2\x80\x94SEATTLE BANS PLASTIC STRAWS \xe2\x80\x94 Fox News\xe2\x80\x99s Kaitlyn Schallhorn: \xe2\x80\x9cSeattle has officially become the first major U.S. city to ban restaurants from giving plastic straws and utensils to customers in an effort to help the environment. Since July 1, restaurants in the Emerald City are barred from providing customers plastic straws, cocktail picks or utensils unless someone specifically requests one. In that case, the customer should be given a compostable option, according to Seattle Public Utilities.With 5,000 food service providers in the area, Seattle is the first major city in the U.S. to enact such a ban, KIRO-TV reported. \xe2\x80\x9cPlastic pollution is surpassing crisis levels in the world\xe2\x80\x99s oceans, and I\xe2\x80\x99m proud Seattle is leading the way and setting an example for the nation by enacting a plastic straw ban,\xe2\x80\x9d Mami Hara, the general manager of Seattle Public Utilities, told KOMO News.\xe2\x80\x9d Read more here \xe2\x80\x94GO AHEAD AND JUMP IN THE FOUNTAIN \xe2\x80\x94 Gothamist\xe2\x80\x99s Jen Carlson: \xe2\x80\x9cWhen it\'s this goddamn hot outside, Washington Square Park\xe2\x80\x99s fountain calls to you like a siren. So, is it legal to just walk into any fountain in NYC? Hell yeah it is. It is not against park rules to go into display fountains, though the Parks Department may discourage it as they are not intended for swimming, and as such the water is not treated in the way a swimming pool is. But, you can still hop in, as long as you are not using it to bathe\xe2\x80\x94it is against park rules to use fountains for personal hygiene or for washing clothes, belongings, or pets .\xe2\x80\x9d Read it here \xe2\x80\x94SCHUMER PULLS A CROWLEY \xe2\x80\x94 Schumer takes heat after canceled town hall, by POLITICO\'s Elana Schor: Activists in Chuck Schumer\xe2\x80\x99s hometown were stewing in frustration, clamoring for more fight from his Senate Democrats, even before he canceled a long-awaited public meeting on Monday night. But once Schumer bowed out, citing an equipment problem that kept his small plane grounded upstate, the frustration reached a simmer that matched the day\xe2\x80\x99s sweltering temperature. After spending nearly a year pressuring the Senate minority leader to meet with his constituents, liberal organizers scrambled to press Schumer to reschedule and not rely on a teleconference that was hastily assembled for him to take their questions. The liberals who\xe2\x80\x99d hoped to see Schumer at a sold-out event resorted to chants of \xe2\x80\x9cdon\xe2\x80\x99t phone it in,\xe2\x80\x9d a possible portent of trouble as he asks his party\'s fired-up base for backup in a long-shot fight against President Donald Trump\xe2\x80\x99s Supreme Court nominee. Read more here.TRUMP\xe2\x80\x99S NEW YORK \xe2\x80\x94IRANIAN DIPLOMAT ARRESTED IN PLOT TO BLOW UP EVENT GIULIANI ATTENDED \xe2\x80\x94 Business Insider\xe2\x80\x99s Rosie Perper: \xe2\x80\x9cAn Iranian diplomat, along with five others, have been arrested over a plot to blow up an event of an exiled Iranian opposition group. The event for the National Resistance Council of Iran (NRCI), an Iranian opposition organization based in France, also featured President Donald Trump\'s lawyer Rudy Giuliani. Belgian police intercepted two suspects on Saturday with 500 grams of a home-made explosive powder, as well as a detonation device in their car, Reuters reported, citing a joint statement by the Belgian prosecutor and Belgian intelligence services.\xe2\x80\x9d Read it here \xe2\x80\x94KIM JONG-UN\xe2\x80\x99S NEW YORK \xe2\x80\x94 Axios: \xe2\x80\x9cSome administration officials are so optimistic about making progress with North Korea\xe2\x80\x99s Kim Jong-un that they hope a Round 2 with President Trump can be held in New York in September, when world leaders pour into Trump\'s hometown for the U.N. General Assembly. The big picture: Officials tell us that Kim would have to show progress for the meeting to occur. One possibility would be for Trump to hold out a Round 2 meeting as a carrot to encourage real movement by North Korea over the summer.\xe2\x80\x9d Read more here. \xe2\x80\x94HELPFUL: \xe2\x80\x9cNPR\xe2\x80\x99s Ari Shapiro speaks with Doris Meissner, former commissioner of the U.S. Immigration and Naturalization Service, about how U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement works and how its structured.\xe2\x80\x9d Listen here SOCIAL DATA: HAPPY BIRTHDAY: Sandra Lee, \xe2\x80\x9cNew York\xe2\x80\x99s First Lady\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\xa6 Lally Weymouth ... He also recently joined the advisory board of the Qatar America Institute.SPOTTED: Malia Obama at Surf LodgeMORNING MEDIA, with POLITICO\xe2\x80\x99s Michael Calderone:\xe2\x80\x94NEWS OUTLETS PAID MELANIA FOR PHOTOS, \xe2\x80\x98POSITIVE\xe2\x80\x99 COVERAGE MANDATED: NBC\xe2\x80\x99s Andrew W. Lehren, Emily R. Siegel and Merritt Enright report that first lady Melania Trump \xe2\x80\x9cearned six figures from an unusual deal with a photo agency in which major media organizations have indirectly paid the Trump family despite a requirement that the photos be used only in positive coverage.\xe2\x80\x9d Getty\xe2\x80\x99s licensing agreement for photos by Belgian photographer Regine Mahaux stipulated the images be used in \xe2\x80\x9cpositive stories only.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x9cNBC News found at least a dozen organizations that had paid to use Mahaux\'s restricted images of the Trumps in 2017, resulting in indirect payment to the first family,\xe2\x80\x9d they write. \xe2\x80\x9cYahoo News, NBC News, Marie Claire, the Daily Mail, My San Antonio, Houston Chronicle, House Beautiful, and SF Gate, the website for The San Francisco Chronicle, are among those that have featured Mahaux\xe2\x80\x99s highly stylized family portraits since Trump took office.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94BARTIROMO SLAMMED FOR SOFTBALL INTERVIEW: Business Insider\'s Eliza Relman writes that \xe2\x80\x9cFox Business Network host Maria Bartiromo is facing particularly fierce criticism over her latest interview with President Trump, during which she lobbed what critics called softball questions and repeatedly agreed with the president\xe2\x80\x99s controversial, false, or misleading statements.\xe2\x80\x9dFox News president Brian Jones defended Bartiromo, telling Business Insider that the host\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cwide-ranging interview with President Trump made news on multiple fronts and elicited answers to numerous questions.\xe2\x80\x9dYou can read the full Morning Media column and sign up to receive it in your inbox by clicking here.REAL ESTATE, with POLITICO New York\xe2\x80\x99s Sally Goldenberg:\xe2\x80\x94AIR STRIKE \xe2\x80\x94 Airbnb ally to back legislation cracking down on the home-sharing giant, by POLITICO\'s Sally Goldenberg: One of Airbnb\'s only allies in the City Council has decided to back legislation designed to regulate the $31 billion short-term rental company in one of its hottest markets, aligning himself with a bill that already had more than enough votes to pass. Brooklyn\'s Robert Cornegy is the 42nd Council member to sign a bill that would require monthly reports from Airbnb and similar companies about their booked listings. Any rental shielded from disclosure to the Mayor\'s Office of Special Enforcement would carry a fine of up to $25,000. Cornegy said he chose to sign the bill after he felt confident he had enough support to pass a separate measure he is sponsoring that would exempt single and two-family homes from enforcement against illegal hotels. He is so far the only sponsor listed on that bill, but believes it will pass and provide enough protection for homeowners in his Bed-Stuy district to justify his endorsement of the reporting requirements. Read more here\xe2\x80\x94MARKET REPORT \xe2\x80\x94 Manhattan home prices and sales continue to drop, market report finds, by POLITICO\'s Sam Raskin: Sales of Manhattan homes continued to decline in the second quarter of this year \xe2\x80\x94 the lowest second-quarter sales in nine years \xe2\x80\x94 according to a new Douglas Elliman Real Estate report conducted in conjunction with Miller Samuel Real Estate Appraisers & Consultants. The report, released Tuesday, found the amount of sales dropped by 16.6 percent compared with the second quarter of 2017. Prices of Manhattan homes declined as well as the price per square foot \xe2\x80\x94 the third consecutive quarter of year-to-year declines, though the decline was less severe than that of the previous quarter. Specifically, median sale prices dropped by 7.5 percent to $1,100,000 and by 2.3 percent per square foot to $1,733. This time the kiosks have been programmed to play ice cream van chimes, leaving parched punters searching in vain for a Whippy treat.\nsomeone hacked the internet kiosk in front of my apartment and it\'s been playing the ice cream truck song for hours\n\xe2\x80\x94 chelsea adelaine hassler (@chelseaadelaine) July 2, 2018\nMotherboard has had a confirmation from LinkNYC that, yes, it\'s really a thing, but\xc2\xa0it\'s denying its an actual hack and besides, free stuff gets abused all the time.\nWhat\'s actually happening is that people are using the booth to make a call to a number that plays ice cream van music. Then, by hitting the home button, it disguises the call.\nSuch japes.\nBut as pointed out, calls to these booths are supposed to auto-hang after\xc2\xa010 minutes. Some residents are talking of chimes lasting "hours", so isn\'t adding up there - either the witnesses are lying or the booths are malfunctioning. Either way, it may not be a conventional hack but it\'s a pretty impressive troll.\nLinkNYC and other schemes like it have faced criticism for the booths which contain a very open infrastructure of wifi and Bluetooth, which, as much as it represents a public service, is also ready for abuse and hacking.\nBut if the worst they can dish out is a bit of porn and some ice cream noises, the future of the Western world is probably safe for now. \xce\xbc\nTweet\nFacebook\nSend to\nTopics\nSecurity\nSecurity\nHacking\nice cream\nPlease enable JavaScript to view the comments powered by Disqus.\nINQ CB1 should refuse to OK any expansion of the rooftop use until Spring starts acting in good faith. And if you live within a three-block radius of 50 Varick, you should be extremely concerned about the \xe2\x80\x9csound amplification\xe2\x80\x9d part of this request.\n2)\xc2\xa0393 Broadway, application for a liquor license for an LLC to be formed by Dothin Negrin \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\nThat\xe2\x80\x99s the event space for pop-ups formerly called The Supermarket and now 393 NYC. The recent misguided piece on Canal Street in the New York Times says that Negrin\xe2\x80\x99s first name is actually Dotan, and he\xe2\x80\x99s (also) a musician.\n3)\xc2\xa0Street Activity Permit Office application for New York Fashion Week: The Shows; Street event; Setup begins August 29, 2018 at 12 AM; Event spans from September 6, 2018 at 9:00 AM through September 13, 2018 at 9:00 PM; Breakdown finishes on September 15, 2018 at 11:59 PM; Multiple Streets \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\n4) The following notices have been received for renewal, upgrade, corporate change, minor alteration or transfer of wine and beer or liquor licenses, renewal of sidewalk caf\xc3\xa9 permits and recurring street closure permits:\n\xe2\x80\x94Street Activity Permit Office application for the \xe2\x80\x9cAnnual Block Party\xe2\x80\x9d; Block Party; Sunday, September 16, 2018; 8:00 AM \xe2\x80\x93 3:30 PM; Reade Street between Broadway and Church Street \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\nIs it too much to ask that CB1 include who is throwing the event?\n\xe2\x80\x9415 Sixth Avenue, application for renewal of liquor license for Tribeca Tavern\n\xe2\x80\x94385 Greenwich Street, application for renewal of liquor license for Yves\nFinancial District\n1)\xc2\xa0213-221 Pearl Street, application for liquor license for Lam Pearl Street Hotel \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\n2)\xc2\xa070 Pine Street, application for wine and beer license for Blue Park \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\n3)\xc2\xa0100 Church Street Club, Inc. application for liquor license for 100 Church Club, Inc. \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\nThe Liquor License Application Questionnaire Summary submitted to CB1 says that the applicant is Douglas McMahon; no mention is made of \xe2\x80\x9cfinancier Joe Lewis, golfing greats Tiger Woods and Ernie Els, and actor and musician Justin Timberlake,\xe2\x80\x9d who are cited on the Nexus Luxury Collection website. The 34,000-square-foot private club is on the seventh floor of 100 Church.\n4)\xc2\xa0515 Hay Road at Governors Island, application for liquor license \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\n5)\xc2\xa026 Vesey Street, application for wine and beer license for Panchak Aggarwal \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\n6)\xc2\xa011 Stone Street, application for liquor license for The Mint \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\n7) The imagine that any rooftop addition wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be visible from across W. Broadway.\n3)\xc2\xa083-85 Worth Street, application for ground floor restoration, rear fa\xc3\xa7ade alterations and rooftop addition \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\nThe storefront of 83-85 Worth could certainly use attention, but I do hope the addition won\xe2\x80\x99t be visible from the street\xe2\x80\x94that\xe2\x80\x99s a lovely strip of buildings.\n7/17\xc2\xa0Waterfront, Parks & Resiliency Committee \xe2\x80\x93 6:00 PM\nLocation: Community Board 1 \xe2\x80\x93 Conference Room, 1 Centre Street, Room 2202A-North\n1)\xc2\xa0Passive House (Follow-up from Resiliency Sub-Committee) \xe2\x80\x93 Resolution\n2)\xc2\xa0Hudson River Park Trust RFPs and Events \xe2\x80\x93 Presentation (tentative)\n3)\xc2\xa0Barnett Newman Triangle \xe2\x80\x93 Update (tentative)\nThat\xe2\x80\x99s the concrete island bordered by Franklin, Church, and Sixth. DDG, developer of 100 Franklin, had said it would redo the triangle into more of a park.\n7/18\xc2\xa0Executive Committee \xe2\x80\x93 6:00 PM\nLocation: Community Board 1 \xe2\x80\x93 Conference Room, 1 Centre Street, Room 2202A-North\n1)\xc2\xa0Howard Hughes Corp Purchase of 250 Water Street \xe2\x80\x93 Presentation, Saul Scherl, HHC\nI\xe2\x80\x99d bet $20 he\xe2\x80\x99ll say the company has no plans to announce yet. HHC tends to dump its news via the Post, which is odd since it\xe2\x80\x99s trying to make the Seaport District upscale and the Post is anything but.\n2)\xc2\xa0Board Processes: Monthly Meeting At all meetings, additional items may be raised as \xe2\x80\x9cNew Business.\xe2\x80\x9d\nTags: 100 Church, 100 Franklin, 250 Water, 39-41 Worth, 393 Broadway, 50 Varick, 83-85 Worth, Barnett Newman Triangle, Community Board 1, DDG, Howard Hughes Corporation, Nexus, Nexus Club New York, Spring Studios\n4 Comments\nN\nJuly 5, 2018 \xe2\x80\xa2 10:40 am\nAnyone have any idea what happened to Serafina\xe2\x80\x99s sidewalk cafe request? Pacific\nSubscribe\nWebinars\nTravel Agent Academy\nVirtual Travel Events\nHotel Rewards\nLast updated: 09:13 AM ET, Tue July 10 2018\nReservations Open for New York City Restaurant Week\nDestination & Tourism\nMonica Poling\nJuly 10, 2018\nPHOTO: Delmonico's restaurant, New York City (photo courtesy of Delmonico's)\nNYC & Company, the official destination marketing organization for the city of New York has announced that reservations for the much-anticipated annual Restaurant Week event are officially being accepted. Now in its 26th year, Restaurant Week will take place over 23 days this summer, running from July 23 through August 17, 2018.Added to this year\xe2\x80\x99s offerings are a new prix-fixe lunch offer with a two-course (appetizer and entr\xc3\xa9e) menu priced at $26. The new menu option waives the previously mandatory third dessert course, saving time for busy travelers on the run.More than 380 restaurants, across 42 distinct neighborhoods, in all five boroughs, will feature the two-course lunch menus and/or three-course prix-fixe dinners (with dessert) for $42.MORE Destination & Tourism\nParis is the Top Destination for Labor Day 2019\nEaster Island Under Threat of Overtourism\nTourists Rescued From Desert After Hot Air Balloon Mishap...\n\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no better way to celebrate the diversity of New York City\xe2\x80\x99s unmatched culinary scene\xe2\x80\x94the true dining capital of the world\xe2\x80\x94than by experiencing a great meal (or two) among restaurants of 33 distinct cuisines participating in NYC Restaurant Week this summer,\xe2\x80\x9d said Fred Dixon. \xe2\x80\x9cWe look forward to welcoming visitors, meetings delegates, and residents to enjoy new dining experiences in neighborhoods across all five boroughs this season.\xe2\x80\x9dThis year\xe2\x80\x99s Restaurant Week line up includes 24 new restaurant participants: Baar Baar, Barano, Boucherie Park Avenue South, Cleo, DaDong, Empell\xc3\xb3n, Fish Cheeks, Gloria, Greenwich Steakhouse, Harvey, La Sirena, Lugo Cucina Italiana, Mifune New York, Naoki Takahashi, Nix, Quality Eats \xe2\x80\x93 Nomad, Royal 35 Steakhouse, Scampi NYC, Talde, The Musket Room, The Sea Fire Grill, The Whitby Bar & Restaurant, Trattoria Italienne, and Tudor City Steakhouse.Diners seeking inspiration on where to dine this summer can will find curated, themed restaurant collections, including such categories as \xe2\x80\x9cNYC Classics,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cSquad Goals\xe2\x80\x9d (group dining), \xe2\x80\x9cSwipe Right\xe2\x80\x9d (date-friendly establishments), and ideal for summer, \xe2\x80\x9cBYO SPF\xe2\x80\x9d (alfresco dining), among others.To remind travelers exactly when to pull out their special knives, forks, ladles, chopsticks and spoons, NYC Restaurant Week is being promoted through digital and print advertising, and through advertising on NYC bus shelters, street pole banners, LinkNYC screens, and NYC taxicabs. Additionally, advertisements in PATH trains and stations feature exclusive creative detailing a NYC Restaurant Week manifesto.Visitors who really, really love what they\xe2\x80\x99re eating should take a moment to memorialize their meal on social media. An Instagram photo contest will award four weekly winners (one each week of the program) with $300 in gift cards from participating restaurants by using the program hashtag #NYCRestaurantWeek.Restaurant Week is sponsored by American Express, which is accepted at an increasing number of eateries in New York. In 2017, more than 9,700 restaurant locations in the New York area started accepting American Express\xc2\xae Cards. Additional partners include OpenTable and the James Beard Foundation. For more information, visit NYCgo.com/restaurantweek.\nFor more information on\nNew York City,\nNew York\nFor more Destination & Tourism News\nMore by Monica Poling\nLos Cabos is a Model for Sustainability\nNative American Travel Association Celebrates 20th Anniversary\nParis is the Top Destination for Labor Day 2019\nEaster Island Under Threat of Overtourism\nTourists Rescued From Desert After Hot Air Balloon Mishap in Egypt\nLake Arrowhead: 'The Alps' of Southern California\nVisitors Increasing as Israel Adds New Developments\nComments\nYou may use your Facebook account to add a comment, subject to Facebook's Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. Curbed NY\nSkip to main content\nclock\nmenu\nmore-arrow\nno\nyes\nNew York\nSubscribe\nLog In or Sign Up\nLog In\nSign Up\nCities\nTopics\nNeighborhoods\nMore\nCities\nAtlanta\nAustin\nBoston\nChicago\nCurbed.com\nDetroit\nLos Angeles\nNew Orleans\nNew York\nPhiladelphia\nSan Francisco\nSeattle\nWashington DC\nTopics\nFor Sale in New York\nFor Rent in New York\nDevelopment\nNews\nHouse Calls\nArchitecture\nMaps\nTransportation\nAffordable Housing\nCelebrity Homes\nNeighborhoods\n\xe2\x9c\x95\nFiled under:\nNews\nLinkNYC kiosks will display fantastical, never-built NYC structures\nNew,\n4\ncomments\nFrom I.M. Pei\xe2\x80\x99s Grand Central-replacing colossus to Buckminster Fuller\xe2\x80\x99s Dodgers Dome in Brooklyn, it\xe2\x80\x99s all in here\nBy\nTanay Warerkar@TanayWarerkar\nJul 10, 2018,\n3:38pm EDT\nShare\nTweet\nShare\nShare\nLinkNYC kiosks will display fantastical, never-built NYC structures\ntweet\nshare\nReddit\nPocket\nFlipboard\nEmail\nVia LinkNYC\nFor its latest campaign, LinkNYC has teamed up with authors Greg Goldin and Sam Lubell to highlight New York structures that were never built. This digital exhibit is a follow up to the release of their book, \xe2\x80\x98Never Built New York,\xe2\x80\x99 which came out in 2016, and their subsequent exhibition at the Queens Museum last fall.\nIn the LinkNYC partnership, these never built projects will be displayed as close as possible to their would be locations in the city. Take for instance I.M. Pei\xe2\x80\x99s Hyperboloid, a 102-story circular tower that would have replaced Grand Central Terminal, and would have been the tallest structure in the world\xe2\x80\x94that will be visible on LinkNYC kiosks near the station.\nOther never built structures that have received recognition on LinkNYC\xe2\x80\x99s digital billboards include Moshe Safdie\xe2\x80\x99s Habitat New York 1, an origami-like luxury residence and shopping complex proposed to rise north of Gracie Mansion, on the Upper East Side; and the domed stadium designed by Buckminster Fuller, that would have kept the Dodgers in Brooklyn. Peek at some of the others below.\nThis is LinkNYC\xe2\x80\x99s latest collaboration following ones with the Museum of the City of New York in March, to honor women activists; and the one with the Department of Records and Information Services (DORIS) last year to show off historic photos of NYC neighborhoods.\nThe New York City transit projects that never were\nHelp bring a \xe2\x80\x98Never Built New York\xe2\x80\x99 exhibit to life at the Queens Museum\nNext Up In\nNews\nNew York Botanical Garden\xe2\x80\x99s stinky corpse flower will bloom soon\nDigital billboards should be banned from NYC waterways: lawmakers\nNew York lawmakers vote to legalize e-bikes, e-scooters\nInfamous landlord to pay $3M in tenant harassment settlement\nNotorious B.I.G.\xe2\x80\x99s childhood home now a $4,000/month rental\nBrooklyn lawmaker wants to resurrect Triboro rail line\nMost Read\nNotorious B.I.G.\xe2\x80\x99s childhood home now a $4,000/month rental\nThe apartment where the late rapper grew up is up for grabs\nWhat $1M buys in NYC right now\nFive apartments, five NYC neighborhoods\nWilliamsburg\xe2\x80\x99s quirky shipping container house lists for $5.5M\nThe home on a corner lot is made up of 21 shipping containers meticulously pieced together\nBrooklyn lawmaker wants to resurrect Triboro rail line\nThe rail line would connect the Bronx, Queens, and Brooklyn\nLovely Ditmas Park townhouse with a huge pool asks $2M\nThe landmarked Brooklyn home has a ton of "old world charm."\nSign up for the\nCurbed NY Newsletter\nEmail (required)\nSubscribe\nBy signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy and European users agree to the data transfer policy.\nThis Article has a component height of 33. All Rights Reserved\nNew York\ntweet\nshare', b"Grassroots Group Confronts Privacy-Invasive WiFi Kiosks in New York\xc2\xa0 | Electronic Frontier Foundation\nSkip to main content\nAboutContact\nPress\nPeople\nOpportunities\nIssuesFree Speech\nPrivacy\nCreativity and Innovation\nTransparency\nInternational\nSecurity\nOur WorkDeeplinks Blog\nPress Releases\nEvents\nLegal Cases\nWhitepapers\nTake ActionAction Center\nElectronic Frontier Alliance\nVolunteer\nToolsPrivacy Badger\nHTTPS Everywhere\nSurveillance Self-Defense\nCertbot\nPanopticlick\nDonateDonate to EFF\nShop\nOther Ways to Give\nSearch form\nSearch\nEmail updates on news, actions,\nand events in your area.\nJoin EFF Lists\nCopyright (CC BY)\nTrademark\nPrivacy Policy\nThanks\nElectronic Frontier Foundation\nDonate\nElectronic Frontier Foundation\nAboutContact\nPress\nPeople\nOpportunities\nIssuesFree Speech\nPrivacy\nCreativity and Innovation\nTransparency\nInternational\nSecurity\nOur WorkDeeplinks Blog\nPress Releases\nEvents\nLegal Cases\nWhitepapers\nTake ActionAction Center\nElectronic Frontier Alliance\nVolunteer\nToolsPrivacy Badger\nHTTPS Everywhere\nSurveillance Self-Defense\nCertbot\nPanopticlick\nDonateDonate to EFF\nShop\nOther Ways to Give\nSearch form\nSearch\nGrassroots Group Confronts Privacy-Invasive WiFi Kiosks in New York\nDEEPLINKS BLOG\nBy rainey ReitmanJuly 10, 2018\nGrassroots Group Confronts Privacy-Invasive WiFi Kiosks in New York\nShare It\nShare on Twitter\nShare on Facebook\nCopy link\nFree WiFi all across New York City? It might sound like a dream to many New Yorkers, until the public learned that it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t \xe2\x80\x9cfree\xe2\x80\x9d at all. LinkNYC, a communications network that is replacing public pay phones with WiFi kiosks across New York City, is paid for by advertising that tracks users, festooned with cameras and microphones, and has questionable processes for allowing the public to influence its data handling policies.\nThese kiosks also gave birth to ReThink LinkNYC, a grassroots community group that\xe2\x80\x99s uniting New Yorkers from different backgrounds in standing up for their privacy. In a recent interview with EFF, organizers Adsila Amani and Mari Dej described the organization as a \xe2\x80\x9chodgepodge of New Yorkers\xe2\x80\x9d who were shocked by the surveillance-fueled WiFi kiosks entering their neighborhoods. More importantly, they saw opportunity. As Dej described, \xe2\x80\x9cAs we began scratching the surface, [we] saw that this was an opportunity as well to highlight some of the problems that are largely invisible with data brokers and surveillance capitalism.\xe2\x80\x9d\nReThink LinkNYC, which has launched an informational website and hosts events across New York, has been pushing city officials for transparency and accountability. They have demanded a halt to construction on the kiosks until adequate privacy safeguards are enacted.\nThe group has already had some successes. As Dej described it, \xe2\x80\x9cWe certainly got the attention of LinkNYC, and that itself is a victory \xe2\x80\x93 [they] know that there is an organized group of everyday peeps unhappy with the lack of transparency around the LinkNYC 'spy kiosks.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\nBut Amani cautioned that it was too early to know whether early changes in response to the group\xe2\x80\x99s advocacy\xe2\x80\x94including a revised LinkNYC privacy policy, the creation of a Chief Privacy Officer role for the city, and a new city taskforce\xe2\x80\x94will actually advance the privacy concerns of New Yorkers. \xe2\x80\x9cWe would like to see the end of individualized tracking of location, faces, and all biometric data on the kiosks,\xe2\x80\x9d Amani offered, \xe2\x80\x9cWith LinkNYC having the means to collect this data and still not having figured out the path for community oversight of the hardware and software, it\xe2\x80\x99s saying trust us, we won't hurt you. That's naive, especially in these times.\xe2\x80\x9d\nReThink LinkNYC has thrived in part because it actively cultivated partnerships, and not just with the tech community. Dej noted, \xe2\x80\x9cInasmuch as the structure of surveillance affects us all, all of us deserve to be aware, and welcomed into action.\xc2\xa0 A movement needs to extend beyond the tech community.\xe2\x80\x9d\nTo other groups around the country that might be interesting in campaigning to defend civil liberties in their own communities, Amani advised organizers to examine the power structures they are opposing and cultivate personal connections: \xe2\x80\x9cCivic involvement remains a more or less fringe activity for a majority of people.\xc2\xa0 So appeal to what human community is\xe2\x80\x94feelings of connection, acceptance, creating a safe world for our children, and a chance to be creative, 'seen', and given a sense that one\xe2\x80\x99s participation is valued. If we'd like our tech future to be cooperative (versus dominated by wealth or authoritarian styles), then that's how we organize.\xc2\xa0 If we dedicate ourselves to unlearning the hierarchical behavioral model, we can more easily sense our power.\xe2\x80\x9d\nDej agreed, adding \xe2\x80\x9cWe have the power, we just have yet to realize it.\xe2\x80\x9d\nReThink LinkNYC joined the Electronic Frontier Alliance (EFA) over a year ago, and has used the network to help connect with other digital rights activists in New York City, get assistance with event promotion, and discuss strategies. Dej shared that EFA has been useful for connecting with other activists, saying, \xe2\x80\x9cIt helps us connect to other people and other parts of this issue that you wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t think of right off the bat, like Cryptoparty, who gave us insight into the technology part of all this\xe2\x80\xa6 It\xe2\x80\x99s also good to see people working and that we\xe2\x80\x99re not the only ones going through this struggle. There are other people fighting different parts of this system as hard as they can.\xe2\x80\x9d\nThe Electronic Frontier Alliance was launched in March 2016 to help inspire and connect community and campus groups across the United States to defend digital rights. While each group is independent and has its own focus areas, every member group upholds five principles:\nFree expression: people should be able to speak their minds to whomever will listen.\nSecurity: technology should be trustworthy and answer to its users.\nPrivacy: technology should allow private and anonymous speech, and allow users to set their own parameters about what to share with whom.\nCreativity: technology should promote progress by allowing people to build on the ideas, creations, and inventions of others.\nAccess to knowledge: curiosity should be rewarded, not stifled.\nTo learn more about the Electronic Frontier Alliance, find groups in your area, or join the alliance, check out our website. \xc2\xa0To learn more about ReThink LinkNYC, visit their website.\nInterviews with ReThink LinkNYC were conducted by phone with follow up over email, and responses edited lightly for clarity.\nRelated Issues\nPrivacyElectronic Frontier AllianceStreet-Level Surveillance\nShare It\nShare on Twitter\nShare on Facebook\nCopy link\nJoin EFF Lists\nJoin Our Newsletter!\nEmail updates on news, actions, events in your area, and more.\nEmail Address\nPostal Code (optional)\nDon't fill out this field (required)\nThanks, you're awesome!
