Le Temps\nAller au contenu principal\nFermerMenu\nUser account menu\nSe connecter\nSe connecter\nServices\nePaper/PDF\nNewsletters\n\xc3\x89v\xc3\xa9nements\nPrivil\xc3\xa8ges abonn\xc3\xa9s\nAnnonces\nAvis de d\xc3\xa9c\xc3\xa8s\nArchives\nFAQ\nContact\nS'abonner\n21 juin. 2019\nRubriques\nMonde\nSuisse\n\xc3\x89conomie\nOpinions\nCulture\nSciences\nSport\nSoci\xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9\nLifestyle\nHyperlien\nEn continu\nBlogs\nVid\xc3\xa9os\nMultim\xc3\xa9dia\nPhotographies\nDossiers\nInteractif\nChappatte\nPodcast\nT Magazine\nPlus\nRECHERCHER\nMots-cl\xc3\xa9s\nFil d'Ariane\nAccueil\nEconomie\nAdela Villanueva, pour que Gen\xc3\xa8ve passe de \xc2\xabje veux faire\xc2\xbb \xc3\xa0 \xc2\xabje fais\xc2\xbb\nPlus d'information sur l'image\nAdela Villanueva: \xc2\xabLes entreprises veulent utiliser de la technologie, mais sans vraiment savoir pourquoi. C\xe2\x80\x99est peut-\xc3\xaatre juste un effet de mode et en r\xc3\xa9alit\xc3\xa9 la solution \xc3\xa0 leur probl\xc3\xa8me passe parfois par autre chose.\xc2\xbb\n\xc2\xa9 Nicolas Duc pour Le Temps\n5 minutes\nde lecture\nTechnologies\nGen\xc3\xa8ve\nS\xc3\xa9bastien Ruche\nPubli\xc3\xa9 jeudi 2 ao\xc3\xbbt 2018 \xc3\xa0 11:33,\nmodifi\xc3\xa9 jeudi 2 ao\xc3\xbbt 2018 \xc3\xa0 20:18.\nCrypto-Suisses (3/4)\nAdela Villanueva, pour que Gen\xc3\xa8ve passe de \xc2\xabje veux faire\xc2\xbb \xc3\xa0 \xc2\xabje fais\xc2\xbb\nElle aide les entreprises \xc3\xa0 apprivoiser les nouvelles technologies. Ses clients sont tr\xc3\xa8s int\xc3\xa9ress\xc3\xa9s par la blockchain et d\xe2\x80\x99autres avanc\xc3\xa9es, mais ils ont surtout besoin\xc2\xa0d\xe2\x80\x99un changement de mentalit\xc3\xa9 et de se dire \xc2\xab\xc2\xa1vamos!\xc2\xbb\n5 minutes\nde lecture\nTechnologies\nGen\xc3\xa8ve\nS\xc3\xa9bastien Ruche\nPubli\xc3\xa9 jeudi 2 ao\xc3\xbbt 2018 \xc3\xa0 11:33,\nmodifi\xc3\xa9 jeudi 2 ao\xc3\xbbt 2018 \xc3\xa0 20:18.\nPartage\nPartager\nTweeter\nPartager\nIls veulent rendre la Suisse cryptocompatible\xe2\x80\xa6 En faire une cryptovalley, une cryptonation\xe2\x80\xa6 Quatre portraits \xc3\xa0 lire dans \xc2\xabLe Temps\xc2\xbb du 30 juillet au 3 ao\xc3\xbbt.Episode pr\xc3\xa9c\xc3\xa9dent:La banqui\xc3\xa8re qui veut faire entrer l\xe2\x80\x99immobilier dans l\xe2\x80\x99\xc3\xa8re crypto\nAntoine Verdon, un ambassadeur de la blockchain\n\xc2\xabMon entreprise doit-elle int\xc3\xa9grer la blockchain?\xc2\xbb A la plateforme genevoise d\xe2\x80\x99innovation Fusion, Adela Villanueva r\xc3\xa9pond quotidiennement \xc3\xa0 cette question. Qui est g\xc3\xa9n\xc3\xa9ralement suivie par cette autre: \xc2\xabAu fait, c\xe2\x80\x99est quoi la blockchain, exactement?\xc2\xbb Apr\xc3\xa8s un an \xc3\xa0 son poste de directrice ex\xc3\xa9cutive, la p\xc3\xa9tillante Espagnole de 36\xc2\xa0ans rel\xc3\xa8ve qu\xe2\x80\x99\xc3\xa0 Gen\xc3\xa8ve, \xc2\xables gens sont entreprenants, ils ont envie de faire des choses, r\xc3\xa9fl\xc3\xa9chissent \xc3\xa0 int\xc3\xa9grer les nouvelles technologies, m\xc3\xaame si leurs connaissances sont peut-\xc3\xaatre moins m\xc3\xbbres qu\xe2\x80\x99\xc3\xa0 Singapour, San Francisco ou New York\xc2\xbb, des endroits o\xc3\xb9 elle a travaill\xc3\xa9 apr\xc3\xa8s ses \xc3\xa9tudes, \xc3\xa0 Lyon et \xc3\xa0 Paris notamment. Mais le moment de passer \xc3\xa0 l\xe2\x80\x99action est venu, milite-t-elle.Au bout du lac, une blague circule dans les milieux \xc2\xabcrypto\xc2\xbb: \xc3\xa0 Gen\xc3\xa8ve, la blockchain est un peu comme le sexe lorsqu\xe2\x80\x99on a 15\xc2\xa0ans. Tout le monde dit qu\xe2\x80\x99il le fait mais personne ne l\xe2\x80\x99a encore fait. Une bonne partie de la mission d\xe2\x80\x99Adela Villanueva consiste justement \xc3\xa0 aider des entreprises \xe2\x80\x93 pas seulement des start-up \xe2\x80\x93 \xc3\xa0 franchir le pas. C\xe2\x80\x99est-\xc3\xa0-dire int\xc3\xa9grer de nouvelles technologies, mais \xc2\xabseulement lorsqu\xe2\x80\x99elles repr\xc3\xa9sentent la bonne solution et cr\xc3\xa9ent de la valeur\xc2\xbb, temp\xc3\xa8re-t-elle dans un fran\xc3\xa7ais parfait et un d\xc3\xa9bit espagnol.Le danger de l\xe2\x80\x99effet de mode\xc2\xabCe qui se passe beaucoup aujourd\xe2\x80\x99hui, notamment avec la blockchain, c\xe2\x80\x99est que les entreprises veulent utiliser de la technologie, mais sans vraiment savoir pourquoi. C\xe2\x80\x99est peut-\xc3\xaatre juste un effet de mode et, en r\xc3\xa9alit\xc3\xa9, la solution \xc3\xa0 leur probl\xc3\xa8me passe parfois par autre chose, par exemple la cr\xc3\xa9ation d\xe2\x80\x99un nouveau service\xc2\xbb, poursuit la sp\xc3\xa9cialiste en transformation num\xc3\xa9rique, qui a notamment travaill\xc3\xa9 dans l\xe2\x80\x99engagement des clients \xc3\xa0 Paris pour des multinationales comme McDonald\xe2\x80\x99s ou Kellogg\xe2\x80\x99s et \xc3\xa0 Singapour avec des marques comme Samsung et Philips.Lire aussi: Comment la blockchain va bouleverser votre vie quotidienneLa plateforme Fusion fournit notamment des cours sur la blockchain et du conseil en mati\xc3\xa8re d\xe2\x80\x99ICO, ces lev\xc3\xa9es de fonds en \xc3\xa9change de jetons num\xc3\xa9riques. Parmi les chantiers figure la cr\xc3\xa9ation d\xe2\x80\x99une communaut\xc3\xa9 de d\xc3\xa9veloppeurs qui cr\xc3\xa9eraient la base technologique de futurs projets men\xc3\xa9s par des entrepreneurs \xc2\xabcoach\xc3\xa9s\xc2\xbb au sein de Fusion.Face \xc3\xa0 des interlocuteurs \xc2\xabparfois un peu perdus devant la technologie, qui r\xc3\xa9duisent souvent la blockchain au bitcoin\xc2\xbb, Adela Villanueva mise sur les cas concrets et le design thinking. Cette th\xc3\xa9orie centr\xc3\xa9e sur l\xe2\x80\x99utilisateur, elle l\xe2\x80\x99a apprise \xc3\xa0 la prestigieuse universit\xc3\xa9 am\xc3\xa9ricaine Stanford, o\xc3\xb9 enseigne justement David Kelley, le concepteur de la \xc2\xabpens\xc3\xa9e design\xc2\xbb, en bon fran\xc3\xa7ais.Trouver les besoins, m\xc3\xaame inconscientsPar opposition \xc3\xa0 l\xe2\x80\x99approche classique qui consiste \xc3\xa0 construire un produit en se concentrant sur la technologie, le faire \xc3\xa9voluer pour essayer de le vendre, \xc2\xabil s\xe2\x80\x99agit pour une entreprise de conna\xc3\xaetre les consommateurs sans savoir vraiment o\xc3\xb9 on va, \xc3\xa9tudier les personnes, conna\xc3\xaetre leurs besoins qui ne sont pas couverts par le march\xc3\xa9 et seulement ensuite cr\xc3\xa9er un nouveau produit pour y r\xc3\xa9pondre\xc2\xbb, illustre celle qui a \xc3\xa9galement pass\xc3\xa9 du temps en immersion dans la Silicon Valley. Bref, \xc2\xabtrouver ce que les consommateurs ne savent pas qu\xe2\x80\x99ils veulent ou ce dont ils ont besoin, mais qu\xe2\x80\x99ils veulent\xc2\xbb.C\xc3\xb4t\xc3\xa9 cas pratiques, son parcours n\xe2\x80\x99en manque pas, entre\xc2\xa0Asie, Europe et Etats-Unis. A Stanford, elle a \xc3\xa9tudi\xc3\xa9 le projet LinkNYC, qui visait \xc3\xa0 remplacer les cabines t\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9phoniques par un r\xc3\xa9seau de bornes interactives fournissant un acc\xc3\xa8s gratuit \xc3\xa0 internet. \xc2\xabLes bornes avaient \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 construites, au prix d\xe2\x80\x99un important investissement, mais personne ne les utilisait. Ce produit \xc3\xa9tait remarquable, tr\xc3\xa8s technologique, mais on ne savait pas \xc3\xa0 quoi il servait\xc2\xbb, se souvient Adela Villanueva, qui a phosphor\xc3\xa9 en 2017 avec des \xc3\xa9tudiants pour trouver une utilit\xc3\xa9 \xc3\xa0 ces bornes. Une des approches retenues consistait \xc3\xa0 les destiner aux touristes n\xe2\x80\x99ayant pas d\xe2\x80\x99acc\xc3\xa8s \xc3\xa0 internet.C\xe2\x80\x99est d\xe2\x80\x99ailleurs cette exp\xc3\xa9rience am\xc3\xa9ricaine men\xc3\xa9e pro bono, faute d\xe2\x80\x99avoir obtenu un visa, qui l\xe2\x80\x99a indirectement conduite \xc3\xa0 Gen\xc3\xa8ve. Le jour o\xc3\xb9 elle et son mari banquier d\xc3\xa9cident de quitter les Etats-Unis, Adela re\xc3\xa7oit un message du patron de Fusion, Sal Matteis, qui veut la d\xc3\xa9baucher. Les futurs \xc2\xabpartners in crime\xc2\xbb se rencontrent un jeudi et elle commence \xc3\xa0 Fusion le lundi suivant, en juillet 2017.Num\xc3\xa9riser la vie suisseUne autre partie importante de son travail au sein de Fusion consiste \xc3\xa0 trouver des start-up prometteuses et \xc3\xa0 les acc\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9rer, notamment en leur faisant profiter du r\xc3\xa9seau de Fusion. A aider des start-up suisses \xc3\xa0 aller dans le reste du monde et inversement \xc3\xa0 aider des entreprises \xc3\xa9trang\xc3\xa8res \xc3\xa0 s\xe2\x80\x99\xc3\xa9tablir en Suisse, par exemple comme porte d\xe2\x80\x99entr\xc3\xa9e sur l\xe2\x80\x99Europe.\xc2\xabLa vie quotidienne est encore peu num\xc3\xa9ris\xc3\xa9e en Suisse, beaucoup de choses doivent encore \xc3\xaatre faites sous forme papier, donc le pays offre beaucoup d\xe2\x80\x99opportunit\xc3\xa9s, analyse-t-elle. Mais quand on parle de la Suisse avec des start-up \xc3\xa9trang\xc3\xa8res, leur premi\xc3\xa8re r\xc3\xa9ponse concerne le co\xc3\xbbt de la vie ici. Elles savent aussi qu\xe2\x80\x99il y a beaucoup d\xe2\x80\x99innovation et de capital disponible en Suisse, c\xe2\x80\x99est un atout, m\xc3\xaame s\xe2\x80\x99il faudrait davantage de capital-risque. Et il faudrait aussi faire davantage pour aider des entrepreneurs \xc3\xa9trangers \xc3\xa0 s\xe2\x80\x99implanter ici.\xc2\xbbLire aussi: Une bourse des valeurs num\xc3\xa9riques est lanc\xc3\xa9e \xc3\xa0 Gen\xc3\xa8veLorsqu\xe2\x80\x99on mentionne les diff\xc3\xa9rents projets genevois li\xc3\xa9s \xc3\xa0 la blockchain, parfois sous l\xe2\x80\x99impulsion des autorit\xc3\xa9s, elle r\xc3\xa9pond sous l\xe2\x80\x99angle de l\xe2\x80\x99\xc3\xa9tat d\xe2\x80\x99esprit: \xc2\xabLa Suisse doit passer de l\xe2\x80\x99\xc3\xa9tape \xc2\xabje veux faire\xc2\xbb \xc3\xa0 \xc2\xabje fais\xc2\xbb, on arr\xc3\xaate de parler et on fait, que ce soit pour la blockchain, l\xe2\x80\x99IoT ou l\xe2\x80\x99int\xc3\xa9gration de start-up \xc3\xa9trang\xc3\xa8res\xc2\xbb. En r\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9, le bout du lac a besoin d\xe2\x80\x99un changement de mentalit\xc3\xa9, d\xe2\x80\x99un basculement vers un principe simple: \xc2\xabOn y va!\xc2\xbbMais on devra y aller pas \xc3\xa0 pas, reconna\xc3\xaet-elle, et \xc2\xaben utilisant la formule Coca-Cola pour les organisations: 70/20/10\xc2\xbb. Elle consiste \xc3\xa0 consacrer 70% d\xe2\x80\x99un budget et des efforts pour int\xc3\xa9grer \xc3\xa0 court terme ce qui permet d\xe2\x80\x99acc\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9rer l\xe2\x80\x99activit\xc3\xa9 imm\xc3\xa9diatement; 20% pour appr\xc3\xa9hender des \xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9ments qui changeront le march\xc3\xa9 dans les deux prochaines ann\xc3\xa9es, et enfin 10% pour financer des projets tr\xc3\xa8s risqu\xc3\xa9s, avec la possibilit\xc3\xa9 qu\xe2\x80\x99ils rapportent beaucoup \xc3\xa0 l\xe2\x80\x99avenir \xe2\x80\x93 autrement dit, selon les mots d\xe2\x80\x99Adela Villanueva, \xc2\xabce qu\xe2\x80\x99il faut absolument regarder pour \xc3\xaatre s\xc3\xbbr que vous n\xe2\x80\x99allez pas mourir dans cinq ou dix ans\xc2\xbb. En Suisse, concr\xc3\xa9tiser ces 10% serait d\xc3\xa9j\xc3\xa0 un bon premier pas, conclut-elle.Profil1982 Naissance en Espagne.2005 Dipl\xc3\xb4me de Sciences politiques \xc3\xa0 Lyon (France).2013 Dirige des projets de num\xc3\xa9risation pour de grandes entreprises \xc3\xa0 Singapour.2015 Certificat en design thinking \xc3\xa0 Stanford.2017 Rejoint la plateforme d\xe2\x80\x99innovation Fusion \xc3\xa0 Gen\xc3\xa8ve.\nPartage\nPartager\nTweeter\nPartager\nPublicit\xc3\xa9\nS\xc3\xa9bastien Ruche\n@sebruche\nJournaliste \xc3\xa9conomie et finance, int\xc3\xa9r\xc3\xaat particulier pour le domaine bancaire \xc3\xa0 Gen\xc3\xa8ve\nVoir ses articles\nLui \xc3\xa9crire\nPublicit\xc3\xa9\n\xc3\x97\nPartager un article\nBonjour,\nUn ami vous recommande un article sur LeTemps.ch:\nAdela Villanueva, pour que Gen\xc3\xa8ve passe de \xc2\xabje veux faire\xc2\xbb \xc3\xa0 \xc2\xabje fais\xc2\xbb\nhttps://www.letemps.ch/economie/adela-villanueva-geneve-passe-veux-faire-fais?utm_source=mail&utm_medium=share&utm_campaign=article\nCordialement,\nLe Temps\nEnvoyer \xef\x87\x98\nSuivez toute l'actualit\xc3\xa9 du Temps sur les r\xc3\xa9seaux sociaux\nFacebook\nTwitter\nInstagram\nLinkedIn\nVos newsletters\nInscrivez-vous et recevez les newsletters de votre choix. Voir la liste.\n\xc3\x80 propos\nAbonnements\nPublicit\xc3\xa9\nServices\nImpressum\nProtection des donn\xc3\xa9es\n\xc3\x97", b'Tel\xc3\xa9fonos p\xc3\xbablicos de Bogot\xc3\xa1 - Bogot\xc3\xa1 - ELTIEMPO.COM\n\xc2\xbfQu\xc3\xa9 hacer con los 7.600 tel\xc3\xa9fonos p\xc3\xbablicos de ETB?\nSuscribirme\nIniciar sesi\xc3\xb3n\nMi cuenta\nConfigurar mis datos\nSuscribirme\nMi suscripci\xc3\xb3n\nVersi\xc3\xb3n impresa\nArt\xc3\xadculos guardados\nBoletines\nClub vivamos El Tiempo\nPreguntas frecuentes\nCerrar sesi\xc3\xb3n\nCargando...\nmis noticias\nmis noticias\nGUARDAR\nIngrese o reg\xc3\xadstrese ac\xc3\xa1\npara guardar los art\xc3\xadculos en su\nzona de usuario y leerlos cuando quiera\nEste art\xc3\xadculo ya fue guardado\nPara consultarlo en otro momento, visite su zona de usuario.\nArt\xc3\xadculo guardado\nPara consultarlo en otro momento, visite su zona de usuario.\nEl art\xc3\xadculo no pudo ser guardado, intente nuevamente\nAc\xc3\xa1 encontrar\xc3\xa1s tus noticias de\nHaz clic aqu\xc3\xad para ver todas las noticias\nBogot\xc3\xa1\nOpini\xc3\xb3n\nColombia\nBogot\xc3\xa1\nInternacional\nPol\xc3\xadtica\nJusticia\nEconom\xc3\xada\nDeportes\nCultura\nTecnolog\xc3\xada\nVida\nClasificados\nM\xc3\xa1s Secciones\nEspeciales\nVideo\nGaler\xc3\xadas\nPodcast\nDatos El Tiempo\nMotor\nCarrusel\nBocas\nLecturas\nHuella Social\nEL TIEMPO TV\nPico y Placa\nClima\n\xc2\xa1Hola\n!, Tu correo ha sido verificado. La empresa asegura que retirarlos costar\xc3\xada 4.000 millones de pesos.\nComentar\nFacebook\nTwitter\nGuardar\nIngrese o reg\xc3\xadstrese ac\xc3\xa1\npara guardar los art\xc3\xadculos en su\nzona de usuario y leerlos cuando quiera\nEste art\xc3\xadculo ya fue guardado\nPara consultarlo en otro momento, visite su zona de usuario.\nArt\xc3\xadculo guardado\nPara consultarlo en otro momento, visite su zona de usuario.\nEl art\xc3\xadculo no pudo ser guardado, intente nuevamente\nEnviar\nLinkedin\nDe los 7.600 tel\xc3\xa9fonos p\xc3\xbablicos que hay en Bogot\xc3\xa1, solo 1.000 se usan. Los vendedores de minutos fueron una competencia importante para estos aparatos.\nFoto:\nAna Puentes\nA\xc3\xban hay m\xc3\xa1s noticias \xc2\xa1Sigue bajando!\nRelacionados:\nBogot\xc3\xa1\nTelecomunicaciones\nComunicaciones\nContenido cierto\nEncuentra la validaci\xc3\xb3n de El Cazamentiras al final de la noticia.\nPor:\nAna Puentes - Escuela de Periodismo Multimedia de El Tiempo\n04 de agosto 2018 , 10:45 p.m.\nDescuelgo el tel\xc3\xa9fono con cierto asco. Est\xc3\xa1 lleno de polvo y telara\xc3\xb1as. No hay tono. Repito la operaci\xc3\xb3n en el resto de Kennedy, y el panorama es el mismo: cabinas abandonadas a su suerte, llenas de grafitis, avisos publicitarios, teclas hundidas, pantallas rotas. En una ma\xc3\xb1ana de recorrido no encontr\xc3\xa9 uno que funcionara. Fue m\xc3\xa1s f\xc3\xa1cil buscar un minuto a 200 pesos.\nEn Bogot\xc3\xa1, los primeros tel\xc3\xa9fonos p\xc3\xbablicos se instalaron por decreto en 1956. En 1990 ya hab\xc3\xada 8.600, y funcionaban con monedas. En el 2000 eran 10.758, y utilizaban pago por tarjeta. En 2007 alcanzaron los 28.518.Pero 62 a\xc3\xb1os despu\xc3\xa9s de la primera llamada en los tel\xc3\xa9fonos tipo caseta, es casi un milagro encontrar alg\xc3\xban tel\xc3\xa9fono p\xc3\xbablico que funcione o al menos, est\xc3\xa9 limpio.En 2018, la Empresa de Telefon\xc3\xada de Bogot\xc3\xa1 (ETB) tiene 7.600 tel\xc3\xa9fonos p\xc3\xbablicos instalados en la ciudad; de estos se usan apenas 1.000, \xe2\x80\x9cespecialmente en c\xc3\xa1rceles, colegios y centros comunitarios. Sin embargo, la irrupci\xc3\xb3n de las nuevas tecnolog\xc3\xadas ha hecho evidente una ca\xc3\xadda significativa en su uso\xe2\x80\x9d, dice un portavoz de la empresa.\nLas cabinas son ahora parte del mobiliario de vendedores informales.\nFoto:\nAna Puentes\nAvanzo por la cuadra del Hospital de Kennedy; ninguno de los tres tel\xc3\xa9fonos p\xc3\xbablicos sirve. Una vendedora informal hizo de uno de ellos su estante de tintos y masa de arepas. \xe2\x80\x9cHace m\xc3\xa1s de un a\xc3\xb1o dej\xc3\xb3 de servir, la gente lo da\xc3\xb1\xc3\xb3\xe2\x80\x9d, asegura.\nNo corresponde a la coyuntura de eficiencia en el gasto por la que pasa la compa\xc3\xb1\xc3\xada\nFACEBOOK\nTWITTER\nAunque la ETB explica que se hacen labores de limpieza, mantenimiento y retiro de los aparatos da\xc3\xb1ados, sacarlos completamente del espacio p\xc3\xbablico costar\xc3\xada alrededor de 4.000 millones de pesos. Un costo inviable, seg\xc3\xban ellos: \xe2\x80\x9cNo corresponde a la coyuntura de eficiencia en el gasto por la que pasa la compa\xc3\xb1\xc3\xada\xe2\x80\x9d.Cuelgo una vez m\xc3\xa1s, tampoco hay respuesta. Doy la vuelta a la cabina, falta la otra unidad. Una vendedora de ropa pide que me retire, necesita acomodar sus maniqu\xc3\xades sobre el punto met\xc3\xa1lico.\nAlguna vez timbraronEn un principio, la ciudad carec\xc3\xada de tel\xc3\xa9fonos p\xc3\xbablicos, por lo que las llamadas se hac\xc3\xadan en los caf\xc3\xa9s.Solo en 1956 se instalaron las primeras cabinas por orden del Concejo. Las filas eran largas para hacer una llamada por 2 o 5 centavos: la conexi\xc3\xb3n ahora era posible en barrios vulnerables.\nLas primeras cabinas eran tipo burbuja.\nFoto:\nLIBRO \xe2\x80\x98ETB. 131 A\xc3\x91OS CONECTANDO VIDAS\xe2\x80\x99\nA principios de los 90 se pens\xc3\xb3 en innovaci\xc3\xb3n. Se instalaron sistemas para pago con tarjeta de cr\xc3\xa9dito y se implementaron llamadas gratis a cambio de escuchar ocho segundos de propaganda. Comenzaba la decadencia.Y lo cierto es que esto coincidi\xc3\xb3 con el vandalismo, que siempre le encontr\xc3\xb3 el quiebre al sistema. Cuando eran tipo monedero, romp\xc3\xadan la caja para robar el producido. Cuando el pago fue por tarjeta, introdujeron objetos por las ranuras y los inutilizaron. Adem\xc3\xa1s, les quitaron las bocinas, se llevaron los cables, abollaron las bases de metal. Y cuando de ellos qued\xc3\xb3 solo el esqueleto, los llenaron de grafitis, les pegaron publicidad, los volvieron puntos de basura y dejaron que los perros orinaran sobre ellos.A inicios de este siglo, la crisis era latente. Aunque se hab\xc3\xada habilitado una tarjeta prepago para promover su uso, los vendedores de minutos les ganaron terreno.En 2014, en un intento por renovar las estructuras se hizo un plan piloto en 40 cabinas para ofrecer internet wifi gratis: permitir\xc3\xada la conexi\xc3\xb3n simult\xc3\xa1nea de 20 personas con una velocidad de un mega. En su momento se dijo que para 2016 habr\xc3\xada 6.000 nodos como estos. Hoy, el proyecto est\xc3\xa1 detenido. Seg\xc3\xban la ETB, \xe2\x80\x9csu implementaci\xc3\xb3n no es compatible con el uso del espacio p\xc3\xbablico reglamentado por las normas t\xc3\xa9cnicas y urban\xc3\xadsticas para las estaciones de telecomunicaciones inal\xc3\xa1mbricas\xe2\x80\x9d.Camino un par de cuadras m\xc3\xa1s, descuelgo el \xc3\xbaltimo tel\xc3\xa9fono. Cerca, un vendedor de chicles y minutos me mira. \xe2\x80\x9cMis celulares s\xc3\xad dan tono, ni\xc3\xb1a\xe2\x80\x9d, dice riendo, y me extiende un viejo Nokia.\nHuawei desplaz\xc3\xb3 a Apple como el segundo mayor fabricante de m\xc3\xb3viles\nFrancia quiere regular el uso de m\xc3\xb3viles para combatir las adicciones\nDescubra con este test qu\xc3\xa9 tan adicto es al celular\nLe doy la espalda a la cabina. M\xc3\xa1s de 60 a\xc3\xb1os de tradici\xc3\xb3n y servicio quedaron hechos polvo y metal corro\xc3\xaddo.\n\xc2\xbfC\xc3\xb3mo lo hicieron otros pa\xc3\xadses?Espa\xc3\xb1a: El diario El Pa\xc3\xads inform\xc3\xb3 que se prepara una ley que les quite su car\xc3\xa1cter de servicio p\xc3\xbablico. Mantener las 15.000 cabinas de esa naci\xc3\xb3n les cuesta 2 millones de euros a los operadores. Muy pocos colectivos han defendido su permanencia en las calles.Estados Unidos: En Nueva York reemplazan los tel\xc3\xa9fonos tradicionales por aparatos de la empresa LinkNYC, una red de puntos inteligentes que, adem\xc3\xa1s de llamadas, ofrece el servicio gratuito de carga de bater\xc3\xada, ubicaci\xc3\xb3n geogr\xc3\xa1fica y conexi\xc3\xb3n wifi. Se financian con publicidad digital. LinkNYC espera instalar 7.500 puntos en los pr\xc3\xb3ximos ocho a\xc3\xb1os.Reino Unido: Las populares cabinas rojas tambi\xc3\xa9n entraron en desuso. Sin embargo, se dio la opci\xc3\xb3n de comprarlas o adoptarlas para conservarlas. Otros las han convertido en bibliotecas o negocios.\nANA PUENTESEscuela de Periodismo Multimedia de El TiempoEn Twitter: @soypuentes\nDescarga la app El Tiempo. Con ella puedes escoger los temas de tu inter\xc3\xa9s y recibir notificaciones de las \xc3\xbaltimas noticias. The dialog window can be moved, resized and closed with the 'x' icon.\nSPONSORED\nData & Technology\nFast forward \xe2\x80\x93 Adshel boss explores the future of tech and out-of-home\n6 August 2018 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa05 min read\nOnce limited to the realms of science fiction, smart tech developments in the out-of-home sector are already driving groundbreaking campaigns around the world. Mike Tyquin on the sector\xe2\x80\x99s future.\nThis article was sponsored by Adshel to let readers know about the future of digital out-of-home\xc2\xa0\xc2\xbb\nOut-of-home (OOH), like other media, is transforming in response to digitisation, data and the changing expectations of advertisers. Digital screens supported by ad servers that update content in response to real-time triggers are already here. Innovative campaigns, too, are also already using rudimentary face recognition, QR codes and image scanning, beacons and citizen wayfinding.\nThere\xe2\x80\x99s plenty of evidence of forward thinking happening in out-of-home (OOH). But what about the future?\nTen years from now, which trends may have the biggest impact on how marketers use OOH? It\xe2\x80\x99s likely to go beyond digital screens, flexible trading, and better verification and reporting. The trends that will play out in the next decade will make the most of internet connectivity, data and mobile communications capabilities.\nOutdoor won\xe2\x80\x99t evolve in isolation, it will respond to the same trends in the advertising, social media, mobile technology and content consumption that impact the whole media sector. What is unique to the future of this medium though is its audience growth.\nUnlike other media, recent digitisation has not resulted in audience fragmentation; in fact, increasing urbanisation means more people are out and about consuming content. The challenges facing outdoor will instead focus on the management of digital technology, new business models, and educating brands and agencies about the creative possibilities.\nNo matter what form outdoor media\xe2\x80\x99s future takes, data is going to be a big part of it. Both the scale of data and how useful it is will take centre stage.\nA key, and somewhat unanswered, question is: what are we going to use data for?\nWill it be more suited to insight led solutions, or precision targeting? Ideally, if the data is good enough and big enough it should be able to do both. Good quality data will enable marketers to specifically target audiences. The data feedback loop will increase measurability, making OOH campaigns more powerful than ever before, generating better reports and more meaningful analytics. Today, location profiling is used to build target audiences based on postcodes and suburbs.\nIn the future, as capability increases to collect and process offline and online audience information, data will become richer, higher quality and more scalable. That means marketers will no longer be targeting audiences via the area where they are located, but instead will be targeting audiences on their behaviour. For example, putting a geofence around a supermarket\xe2\x80\x99s customer footprint and then identifying devices that visit that supermarket more than three times a week enables marketers to build a custom audience of regular grocery shoppers.\nThis evolution from location profiling to building custom audiences means better targeting and more effective marketing. It\xe2\x80\x99s not just campaign and audience data sources to consider. The addition of data from mobiles, smartwatches and other wearables will change the way OOH is targeted and deployed to create contextually relevant ads. Interactive experiences and instantaneous delivery will increasingly feature in OOH. Retargeting will become a possibility with ads seemingly following you as you move around.\nAn ad on a train will pop up on the street as you exit the station, you\xe2\x80\x99ll see it again on a digital screen at your favourite caf\xc3\xa9 and it will seem to travel with you as you move around the shopping centre. OgilvyOne\xe2\x80\x99s 2015 Battersea Dogs Home campaign is an early example of how radio frequency ID can be used to have ads \xe2\x80\x98follow\xe2\x80\x99 people. Like the Battersea Dogs Home campaign shows, as creatives develop their approach to the future possibilities of digital OOH, they will adjust the broadcast messaging so it connects with audiences in specific locations \xe2\x80\x93 and do so at scale.\nA media buy of 2000 panels could potentially deliver 2000 contextually relevant messages. The rollout of innovations like these will challenge the way creatives build campaigns. Technology-enabled screens able to intelligently deliver relevant messages \xe2\x80\x93\xc2\xa0by recognising a single consumer, knowing how many people are standing in front of it, what time of day it is and what the weather is like \xe2\x80\x93 are likely to become widespread in high-frequency areas.\nPersonalised posters featured in the sci-fi film Minority Report set in 2054, but posters with advertising pitched at an individual are almost with us now.\nFor instance, IBM has publicised development work on its facial recognition systems. NEC has run trials in Japan using posters that can calculate the gender and age of an individual. Pedestrians don\xe2\x80\x99t have to stop and look at the screen; they only need to pass by to be recognised, so smart posters will be ideal executions for heavy foot traffic areas. Technology-enabled screens will also have the potential to cultivate a second sector for OOH advertising.\nOut-of-home will continue to deliver broadcast advertising and brand building; it may also develop a parallel capability that moves beyond targeting to personalisation \xe2\x80\x93 advertising delivered for a specific individual. The rollout of tech-supported digital screens will be expensive to build and install. They will only become commonplace if the development of technology aligns with consumer privacy and individual data protection trends.\nBrands will need to unambiguously communicate to consumers their ability to control and opt-out of personalised advertising. The high penetration of smart devices, and increased phone functionality, combined with improved outdoor data supply, are key trends that will influence how out-of-home connects with audiences on the move. Tech supported screens like the ones described above also open up the possibilities of interactive out-of-home (IOOH) \xe2\x80\x93 advertising that can jump off the screen to a mobile, continuing the conversation. Interactivity between digital screens and smart devices may well prove to be one of the biggest opportunities for OOH in the coming years because of how impactful it will be.\nAt the moment there is no technology that can unlock mass market interactivity between smartphones and posters, so it is less developed than facial recognition. Questions are yet to be answered about where and when consumers will be willing to interact with posters, and whether that be passive (perhaps by receiving mobile content simply by walking past a poster) or whether interaction will work only when a decision to download is made.\nThe expenditure required to make this sort of tech widespread will be influenced by identifying locations with significant dwell time and engagement. Bus shelters, train stations and shopping areas have higher dwell-times, while some retail and airports have greater engagement levels.\nThe other factor that needs to be solved is the speed at which an outdoor device can connect with a smart device.\nTo be effective, connection will need to happen instantaneously. Delivering data as consumers pass a screen is more viable in low-dwell time locations. Interaction that requires stopping or a more time-consuming action like touching a device to a screen will only make sense in high engagement locations.\nOutdoor media will increasingly work with councils to play a role in delivering smart cities. A smart city integrates technology into the lives of residents to make them safer, more efficient and easier. The Internet of Things (IoT) will connect OOH screens with mobile phones and buses and trains. Conceivably, you could be notified by your phone that your bus is running late and it could then suggest nearby caf\xc3\xa9s to visit while you wait or, if it\xe2\x80\x99s raining, suggest a walking route to your destination with the most shelter.\nOutdoor screens and street furniture will be connected to a city\xe2\x80\x99s lighting grid. City infrastructure will recognise patterns of low pedestrian traffic and send a signal to street lights, wayfinding and ad screens to turn off when they\xe2\x80\x99re not needed.\nIn New York City, LinkNYC has delivered public Wi-Fi hubs that combine digital ad screens with superfast Wi-Fi, charging ports and a tablet giving access to local maps and other points of interest. In Paris, 100 of the city\xe2\x80\x99s iconic newspaper kiosks will be upgraded next year with OOH touch screens, offering digital self-service, event ticket sales and device-charging.\nOnly in its infancy, wayfinding and other citizen services will grow to better integrate OOH advertising assets with useful functionality for residents. It is this theme of connectivity that best captures the direction of OOH in the next 10 years. Out-of-home will be better integrated, with the internet, mobile devices and city infrastructure. And it won\xe2\x80\x99t just be about pushing out messages; it will be about meaningful enhancement of audiences\xe2\x80\x99 lives as advertisers connect to audiences.\nMike Tyquin is Adshel CEO.\nAdshel is now trading ads by time, day and location. Find out more\xc2\xa0\xc2\xbb\nTHE FUTURE\n\xc2\xab Experience and data guardianship are the keys to customer loyalty \xe2\x80\x93 global surveyTourism Australia CMO on defining Brand Australia and why we don\xe2\x80\x99t want to be a bucket list destination \xc2\xbb\npopular RECENT\n1The five automation skills every...\n2Australia\xe2\x80\x99s top 100 youth brands...\n3Study shows 30% of Google search...\n4Machines have changed marketing...\n5Love or Hate it three: Adam Ferrier...\n1Hidden work \xe2\x80\x93 tiny tasks that make...\n2The tools and rules of attention \xe2\x80\x93...\n3Front and centre \xe2\x80\x93 spring time opens...\n4US Senate has questions for...\n5The next Pok\xc3\xa9mon Go? News, insight, case studies, reports, tools and the magazine are all designed to give Australia\xe2\x80\x99s professional marketers the advantage in their business and career.\nConnect with style:\nMenu Style 1\nMenu Style 2\nMenu Style 1\nBackground:\nBoxed\nStretched\nBackground patterns:", b"Jody Smith of Broadsign: unlocking new communication potential in the era of smart cities | MAA\nDon't Miss\nSorrell boosts S4\xe2\x80\x99s global reach with BizTech deal\nXbox Adaptive Controller wins deserved Brand Experience GP for McCann New York\nOcean brings digital Out of Home network to Birmingham\nJane Austin at Cannes: Childish Gambino\xe2\x80\x99s This is America sets the bar for creativity \xe2\x80\x93 for everyone\nLeagas Delaney launches \xe2\x80\x9cvolcanic chocolate\xe2\x80\x9d Firetree\nWoke-washing, re-inventing creativity and all the other things that may (or may not) be good for business\nMore About Advertising The alternative voice of advertising, marketing and media\nHome\nNews\nAdvertisers\nAgencies\nCreative\nMedia\nFinance\nPolitics\nPR\nAnalysis\nAd Tech\nShop\nAbout us/Partner Content\nContributors\nContact us\nJody Smith of Broadsign: unlocking new communication potential in the era of smart cities\nPosted by:\nStephen Foster\nin\nAd Tech, Advertisers, Analysis, Best Ads of the Year, Creative, Finance, Media\nAugust 9, 2018\nComments Off on Jody Smith of Broadsign: unlocking new communication potential in the era of smart cities\n25 SharesShareTweetShareSmart cities have long been a concept reserved for sci-fi films, but with recent technological advancements, they\xe2\x80\x99re quickly becoming a reality. Media owners have begun to make city-wide audiences available and more addressable using smart city technology in less intrusive ways than the retina scanning technology that served up personalized ads in sci-fi thriller Minority Report.\nFor instance, sensor technology built into digital posters is used to more accurately estimate the number of shoppers in the vicinity at a given time of day, while traffic monitoring provides insight into traffic patterns that can be used to adjust playback duration on billboard content.\nTaking cues from the ad industry, urban planners are exploring how similar data and technology can be implemented to improve urban life. Across the globe, cities are getting smarter. A recent report projects the smart cities industry to exceed $1.2 billion by 2022, a figure that will continue to trend upward as new advances in big data, AI, IoT, 5G and sensor arrays make smart cities more viable. But what makes a city intelligent, and what role will advertising play in the continued smart city evolution? How will smart cities change the way brands communicate with audiences?\nA smart city uses real-time data and technology to improve the urban experience while keeping the populace informed via channels such as road signage, shopping kiosks, connected vehicles, and mobile devices. New York City, London, Philadelphia and Newark have already begun implementing smart city elements.\nIntersection\xe2\x80\x99s interactive Link kiosks (below), spread throughout city sidewalks, provide residents and travelers with free Wi-Fi, access to municipal services, transit routes, directions and more. Another great example is JCDecaux\xe2\x80\x99s sustainable smart bus shelters in Paris, which provide real-time traffic information and USB charging ports.\nA key function of any smart city is informing the public, which requires a means to communicate everything from AMBER Alerts to natural disaster warnings and transit outages/updates. Digital out-of-home displays typically used for advertising, along with mobile devices, are quickly becoming the conduit through which smart cities communicate these messages to the public. In the near future, we\xe2\x80\x99ll likely see the number of \xe2\x80\x9csmart\xe2\x80\x9d kiosks grow, as well as more traditional outdoor displays and street furniture become digitized.\nBuilding, powering and maintaining these communication outposts, however, requires extensive financial backing, and cities are beginning to explore various means to fund these projects. To date, public-private partnerships have proven one of the more favorable options. A number of private sector businesses have been working with local governments to provide resources for communicating with citizens, such as Intersection\xe2\x80\x99s LinkNYC kiosks or Sidewalk Labs\xe2\x80\x99 investment in the Sidewalk Toronto project.\nFor private companies to sustain these projects, monetization is key, and advertising is proving a viable revenue stream. LinkNYC is funded in part by ad revenue and on track to generate more than $500 million for the city over the course of 12 years, and Kansas City, MO has already started to see ad revenue roll in from 25 smart kiosks backed by Cisco and Sprint. As a result, the audience that advertisers want to reach will likely play a key role in determining the location of displays and sensor technology.\nSmart cities arrive at a prime time for the ad industry, in an age of ad blockers and DVR, and one where consumers are increasingly fatigued by what they deem an onslaught of irrelevant mobile and online ads. They open up potential for brands and advertisers to rethink how they connect with consumers, and more accurately target the right audiences at the right time with meaningful content that proves useful to locals and travelers as they navigate their days.\nUsing geolocation, traffic and Wi-Fi data from smart city technology, brands can deliver more personalized, omni-channel campaigns with location-based messaging \xe2\x80\x93 whether on a mobile device, nearby digital billboard or kiosk, a connected car, or a combination thereof. For instance, a passenger stepping off a city bus around lunch time might interact with an ad that provides discount for a local restaurant a few blocks away as they check the transit schedule.\nSmart cities are a win-win for advertisers and the public. By enabling the development and delivery of more targeted, relevant messages, they allow brands to leave a lasting impression with audiences, which could result in greater brand loyalty and influence buying behaviors. At the same time, local residents and travelers benefit from advertisements that cater more specifically to their needs and interests, as well as the information that ad-funded smart city technology provides.\nThere\xe2\x80\x99s no doubt that cities around the world are rapidly embracing smart technology to improve urban life. At the simplest level, today I can pay for parking without any change or a meter in most cities, and in others I can find a free parking spot on an app and reserve it. Factor in self-driving cars, and eventually we\xe2\x80\x99ll have our own personal valets. Smart cities are quickly simplifying our day-to-day, and once commonplace, the old way of doing things will seem as foreign as using a paper map today versus a GPS.\nAs they continue to evolve, advertising will be a key piece of the puzzle, as both a monetization source and influence on the messages we see every day on the street, in transit, via the internet and on our mobile devices. The data that smart cities generate, handled responsibly, introduces a host of new opportunities for advertisers to measure and reach audiences in new ways, giving the industry a chance to reshape consumer perception of and interaction with advertising overall.\nJody Smith is product manager at global digital signage provider Broadsign.\nYou May Also Like\nPaul Simons: the ad that restored my faith in advertising\nHow Smartology connects news brands with top advertisers\nTech company ITG buys Connect marketing agency\nNow MediaMonk Sorrell sets his sights on media agency\nAlan Rutherford of Ebiquity: Cannes Lions marks a new era of more professional media management\nProof that data works - for savvy goalies anyway\nbroadsign smart cities 2018-08-09\nStephen Foster\nAbout Stephen Foster\nStephen is a former editor of Marketing Week and London Evening Standard advertising columnist. He wrote City Republic for Brand Republic and is a partner in communications consultancy The Editorial Partnership.\nSponsored\nRichard Bond of Talon:\nhow Out of Home advertising can create the tipping point for start-up success\nApril 10, 2018\nShould you have branded packaging for your deliveries?\nMarch 26, 2018\nTalon Outdoor: a new manifesto for Smarter as Standard out of home planning\nMarch 21, 2018\nHighlighting the hackers \xe2\x80\x93 Hiscox utilises digital OOH to display real-time cyber attacks\nMarch 5, 2018\nTalon Canvas \xe2\x80\x93 exploring the creative potential in OOH\nFebruary 19, 2018\nRecent Comments\nCynthia: thanks all for showing intelligent life still lives in the a...\nMatt Keen: Good luck Neil. Powered by WordPress with help of KREE Media.\n| Cookies explained.", b"Google's Public DNS turns '8.8.8.8 years old,' teases 'exciting' future announcements - 9to5Google\nSwitch site\nExclusives\nGoogle\nGoogle Pixel 2\nGoogle Pixel 2 XL\nGoogle Pixel 3\nGoogle Pixel 3 XL\nGoogle Home\nGoogle Wifi\nGoogle Daydream\nChromecast\nNexus\nGoogle Cardboard\nNest\nAndroid\nSamsung\nMotorola\nLG\nHTC\nOnePlus\nLenovo\nHuawei\nAsus\nAuto\nTV\nWear OS\nChrome\nChromebooks\nChromecast\nChromecast Ultra\nChromecast Audio\nYouTube\nYouTube TV\nYouTube Kids\nYouTube Red\nAlphabet\nWaymo\nVerily Life Sciences\nCalico\nDeepMind\nJigsaw\nGoogle Ventures\nGoogle Fiber\nAccess & Energy\nG Suite\nGmail\nGoogle Calendar\nGoogle Docs\nGoogle Plus\nGoogle Hangouts\nGoogle Drive\nGoogle Keep\nGoogle Vault\nJamboard\nVideos\nToggle main menu\nMore social networks\nSubmit a Tip / Contact Us\nTrade In\nToggle search\n9to5Mac\n9to5Toys\nElectrek\nDroneDJ\nAbout\nCommunity\nAugust 13, 2018\nGoogle\xe2\x80\x99s Public DNS turns \xe2\x80\x988.8.8.8 years old,\xe2\x80\x99 teases \xe2\x80\x98exciting\xe2\x80\x99 future announcements\nAbner Li\n- Aug. 13th 2018 9:15 am PT\n@technacity\nApps & Updates\n0\nFacebookTwitterPinterestLinkedInReddit\nThe\xc2\xa0Domain Name System (DNS)\xc2\xa0protocol is responsible for turning user-friendly domain names like google.com into the numerical 216.58.216.46 IP address understood by computers. Back in December 2009, Google Public DNS launched and the service just\xc2\xa0celebrated\xc2\xa0its 8.8.8.8 anniversary, while teasing upcoming announcements in light of increased competition.\nThis particular anniversary occurred yesterday on August 12th, 2018 at 12:30 AM UTC and marks eight years, eight months, eight days, and eight hours since the original announcement. Google chose this occasion to coincide with how the public IP address of its Public DNS service is 8.8.8.8 (and 8.8.4.4). It\xe2\x80\x99s memorability helps when users configure network settings and set their DNS servers.\nGoogle notes a recent study that pegs usage of 8.8.8.8 at 10% of internet users. As the largest public DNS resolver, hundreds of millions of users result in a trillion queries served per day. A \xe2\x80\x9cbig part\xe2\x80\x9d of growth comes from free public internet, like services in San Francisco parks and\xc2\xa0LinkNYC kiosk hotspots.\nIt is also used by Google Station in Indian railway locations, while ISPs in Africa and Southeast Asia rely on it to resolve customer DNS queries, with Google noting that it\xe2\x80\x99s in line\xc2\xa0with the\xc2\xa0Next Billion Users initiative. Additionally, in recent history, Google Public DNS played a role in getting Turkish users online after the government blocked Twitter.\nBack in 2009, Google\xe2\x80\x99s goal for launching a public DNS resolver was to make the web faster by leveraging its\xc2\xa0global data center and caching infrastructure.\nGoogle Public DNS resolvers\xe2\x80\x99 DNS caches hold tens of billions of entries worldwide. And because hundreds of millions of clients use them every day, they usually return the address for your domain queries without extra lookups, connecting you to the internet that much faster.\nOn the security front, Google published a privacy practice statement noting what the collected information is used for \xe2\x80\x9cand how it\xe2\x80\x99s not used,\xe2\x80\x9d while also working to secure it from hijacking attempts and denial of service attacks.\nLooking forward, Google acknowledges recent and notable entries into the space, including\xc2\xa0Cloudflare\xe2\x80\x99s 1.1.1.1 in April. Noting that security is still a focus, Google teased \xe2\x80\x9cexciting Google Public DNS announcements in the near future.\xe2\x80\x9d\nCheck out 9to5Google on YouTube for more news:\nGuides\nGoogle Public DNS\nAbout the Author\nAbner Li\n@technacity\nEditor. Interested in the minutiae of Google and Alphabet. Tips/talk: abner@9to5g.com\nGoogle is done with tablets, focusing on laptops\nGmail for Android gains buggy dark theme in settings\nGoogle Pixel 3a: Best screen protectors [Video]\nGoogle Home Essentials: meross Smart Power Strip", b'Google celebra oito anos de seu DNS p\xc3\xbablico, o famoso 8.8.8.8 - Internet\nCanaltech\nHome\nInternet\nGoogle celebra oito anos de seu DNS p\xc3\xbablico, o famoso 8.8.8.8\nPor Reda\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o | 13 de Agosto de 2018 \xc3\xa0s 22h20\nTudo sobre\nGoogle\nSaiba tudo sobre Google\nVer mais\nEm 2009, a Google lan\xc3\xa7ou seu DNS p\xc3\xbablico com o famoso endere\xc3\xa7o 8.8.8.8. Pois bem: no \xc3\xbaltimo domingo (12), a gigante comemorou oito anos, oito meses, oito dias e oito horas de exist\xc3\xaancia do DNS, exatamente \xc3\xa0s 0h30.\nA companhia, ent\xc3\xa3o, preparou uma publica\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o em seu blog de seguran\xc3\xa7a para celebrar a ocasi\xc3\xa3o, nos lembrando da import\xc3\xa2ncia de seu DNS p\xc3\xbablico para manter a internet mais veloz em todo o mundo. CDNs (Content Delivery Networks, ou Redes de Distribui\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o de Conte\xc3\xbados) usam bastante o DNS p\xc3\xbablico da Google, sendo elas redes de servidores que armazenam r\xc3\xa9plicas de conte\xc3\xbados de outros sites em cache e, depois, as entrega aos visitantes, conectando-os ao servidor mais pr\xc3\xb3ximo e mais veloz naquele momento \xe2\x80\x94 reduzindo, portanto, a lat\xc3\xaancia (tempo de transfer\xc3\xaancia dos dados). Segundo as informa\xc3\xa7\xc3\xb5es da companhia, os DNS 8.8.8.8 e 8.8.4.4 s\xc3\xa3o usados por mais de 10% de todos os usu\xc3\xa1rios da internet global como DNS prim\xc3\xa1rio, com a realiza\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o de mais de um trilh\xc3\xa3o de consultas di\xc3\xa1rias. "Quando iniciamos o projeto em 2007, a Google j\xc3\xa1 havia agilizado a busca na web, mas ainda demorava um pouco. Naquela \xc3\xa9poca, a maioria das pesquisas de DNS usava os resolvedores de seu provedor e, com caches pequenos, muitas vezes precisavam fazer v\xc3\xa1rias consultas ao DNS antes de retornarem um endere\xc3\xa7o", explica a gigante.Participe do nosso Grupo de Cupons e Descontos no Whatsapp e garanta sempre o menor pre\xc3\xa7o em suas compras de produtos de tecnologia. As CDNs dependem, portanto, da velocidade para transmitir v\xc3\xaddeos ou jogos sem atrasos, por exemplo, mas o DNS p\xc3\xbablico da Google tamb\xc3\xa9m \xc3\xa9 usado por servi\xc3\xa7os de conex\xc3\xa3o p\xc3\xbablica, como \xc3\xa9 o caso dos hotspots da LinkNYC, nos EUA, e tamb\xc3\xa9m da Google Station na \xc3\x8dndia.\nFonte: Google Security Blog\nGostou dessa mat\xc3\xa9ria?\nInscreva seu email no Canaltech para receber atualiza\xc3\xa7\xc3\xb5es di\xc3\xa1rias com as \xc3\xbaltimas not\xc3\xadcias do mundo da tecnologia.\nSua inscri\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o foi registrada. Intelligence\nLideran\xc3\xa7a\nMarketing\nGoverno\nInfra\nVer Tudo\nBig Data\nComputa\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o na nuvem\nData Center\nTelecom\nVirtualiza\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o\nInova\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o\nVer Estamos contratando!\nF\xc3\xb3rum\nLembrar de mim?\nTudoAndroid\nTudoWindows\nTudoApple\nTudoPlanos\nReviews\nCompare\nCelulares\nVeja Tamb\xc3\xa9m\nGuias e Apps\nPre\xc3\xa7os\nV\xc3\xaddeos\nTemas\nWallpaper\nJogos\nGoogle Public DNS comemora anivers\xc3\xa1rio brincando com seu n\xc3\xbamero\n13 de agosto de 2018 3\nNot\xc3\xadcias\nTudoAndroidAppleWindowsPlanos\nEm dezembro de 2009, o Google anunciou o DNS p\xc3\xbablico pr\xc3\xb3prio, que \xc3\xa9 conhecido pelos n\xc3\xbameros 8.8.8.8 e 8.8.4.4, sendo estes, muito utilizados desde ent\xc3\xa3o.\nSabendo disso, o Google resolveu ent\xc3\xa3o comemorar o anivers\xc3\xa1rio do dom\xc3\xadnio p\xc3\xbablico n\xc3\xa3o na data exata, mas sim ao completar oito anos, oito meses, oito dias e oito horas do seu DNS (8.8.8.8). O dito anivers\xc3\xa1rio aconteceu ontem (dia 12/08) \xc3\xa0s 9:30h hor\xc3\xa1rio de Bras\xc3\xadlia.\nPara quem est\xc3\xa1 perdido e nunca ouviu falar nele, o DNS \xc3\xa9 um servi\xc3\xa7o que tem como miss\xc3\xa3o tornar os nomes de sites mais f\xc3\xa1ceis de se memorizar, substituindo uma sequ\xc3\xaancia num\xc3\xa9rica por uma URL formada por palavras. Sem ele, por exemplo, precisar\xc3\xadamos memorizar que o site google.com seria na verdade 216.58.216.46.\nSaiba como usar! Cloudflare lan\xc3\xa7a novo DNS que promete deixar internet mais r\xc3\xa1pida\n5\nSeguran\xc3\xa7a\n03 Abr\nVictory! Google e Cloudflare derrubam botnet composta por mais de 12 mil celulares Android\n10\nAndroid\n29 Ago\nAl\xc3\xa9m do Google, existem tamb\xc3\xa9m o OpenDNS (que \xc3\xa9 utilizado inclusive por empresas como a Xerox, Evernote, NVIDIA, Pinterest e outras) e a recentemente anunciada Cloudflare, que est\xc3\xa1 dispon\xc3\xadvel atrav\xc3\xa9s do endere\xc3\xa7o 1.1.1.1.\nPara se ter uma no\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o da import\xc3\xa2ncia do DNS p\xc3\xbablico fornecido pela gigante das buscas, um estudo recente apontou que aproximadamente 10% dos usu\xc3\xa1rios de internet utilizam ele atualmente, sendo o maior \xe2\x80\x9cresolvedor\xe2\x80\x9d de DNS p\xc3\xbablico atualmente no mundo.\nAl\xc3\xa9m dos usu\xc3\xa1rios dom\xc3\xa9sticos que costumam configurar para o referido servi\xc3\xa7o, tamb\xc3\xa9m existem os servi\xc3\xa7os de conex\xc3\xa3o p\xc3\xbablica gratuita que se valem dele como os hotspots da LinkNYC, pela Google Station na \xc3\x8dndia e em parques de S\xc3\xa3o Francisco.\nPara quem quiser saber como alterar o DNS utilizado por seus computadores, aqui no site tem um tutorial bem completo explicando como fazer. Youtuber cria conceito do Galaxy Note 10 Tesla Edition\n3\nComent\xc3\xa1rios\n3\nComent\xc3\xa1rios\nGoogle Public DNS comemora anivers\xc3\xa1rio brincando com seu n\xc3\xbamero\n-\n+\nVer no f?rum\nuBlast\n?\n11 meses atr?s\nDNS do google \xc3\xa9 bem mais ou menos...\nver m?s\n0\n0\n?\nResponder\n-\n+\nVer no f?rum\nAntonio_Souza\n?\n11 meses atr?s\nImagina IPv6 ent\xc3\xa3o:\ncpdqg@cpdqg:~$ host google.com\ngoogle.com has address 216.58.222.78\ngoogle.com has IPv6 address 2800:3f0:4004:804::200e\nver m?s\n1\n0\n?\nResponder\n-\n+\nVer no f?rum\ntechmicrosoft\n?\n11 meses atr?s\nEita!\nver m?s\n1\n0\n?\nResponder\nDestaques\nAndroid\nMelhores smartphones: TOP 5 do TudoCelular para voc\xc3\xaa | Junho 2019\nEspeciais\nNada de Black Fraude! Ferramenta do TudoCelular desvenda ofertas falsas\nAndroid\nTOP 10 smartphones de elite com melhor desempenho | Guia do TudoCelular\nAndroid\nTOP 10 smartphones de elite com melhor autonomia | Guia do TudoCelular\n\xc2\xa9 2018 - TUDOCELULAR TECNOLOGIA LTDA.\nFale conosco \xc2\xbb\nReda\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o \xc2\xbb\nAnuncie \xc2\xbb\nTrabalhe conosco \xc2\xbb\nCookie \xc2\xbb\nEnglish Version', b'Google plans to enhance its Public DNS as it celebrates numerological anniversary\nHomeNews\nAcquisition Appointments Cloud Datacenter Green Tech Hosted Cloud Apps Hosting Innovation New Products Partnership Social Media Start-Ups Technology\nArticlesInterviewsInfographicsSubmit\nSubmit Hosting Coupon Submit a Press Release Submit a Guest Article\nUpcoming Events\nHomeNews\nAcquisition Appointments Cloud Datacenter Green Tech Hosted Cloud Apps Hosting Innovation New Products Partnership Social Media Start-Ups Technology\nArticlesInterviewsInfographicsSubmit\nSubmit Hosting Coupon Submit a Press Release Submit a Guest Article\nUpcoming Events\nShare This Post\nNews\nGoogle plans to enhance its Public DNS as it celebrates numerological anniversary\nBy Virendra Soni\non\nAugust 14, 2018\nNo Comments\n/\n1088 views\nGoogle Public DNS (Domain Name System), the well-known IP address 8.8.8.8, turned eight years, eight months, eight days and eight hours old on Sunday, 12th August 2018, at 00:30 UTC.\nThe DNS protocol is used to convert the user-friendly domain names into IP addresses which can be easily understood by computers. The aim of using domain name systems like 8.8.8.8 is to make the internet faster for users, safeguard the privacy, and access internet sites more reliably and securely.\nCurrently, over 10% of the internet users rely on 8.8.8.8, and it serves more than a trillion queries every day. A big part of the protocol comes from free public internet, such as Google Station services offered by Indian railway stations, parks in San Francisco, LinkNYC kiosk hotspots etc.\nOn the occasion of numerological anniversary, the search engine giant announced a number of upcoming improvements to the protocol.\nGoogle said that accelerating the DNS responses is just one part of making the web faster, but getting the web content from servers closer to the users can have the bigger impact. The content delivery networks (CDNs) use DNS for directing users to nearest servers for distribution of content like video streaming to the users. When the ISP resolver is far away from the user, it can impact loading time.\nThe search engine giant will continue to improve the EDNS Client Subnet (ECS) extension, such as adding automatic detection of name server ECS support. the support for ECS is now widespread among CDNs.\nOn the privacy front, Google is strengthening the way it collects and uses information. Google is working in the IETF and with other DNS operators on the Internet Draft for DNS Queries over HTTPS specification.\nAdditionally, the ability of Google Public DNS to protect the integrity of DNS responses is also being improved. It will be able to block DNS denial of service attacks by limiting the rate of queries to name servers and reflection that flood network connections.\nAlso read: Internet domain names will soon be available in Indian regional scripts\n\xe2\x80\x9cIn short, we continue to improve Google Public DNS both behind the scenes and in ways visible to users, adding features that users want from their DNS service,\xe2\x80\x9d wrote Google in a blog post.\nRate this post\n8.8.8.8 content delivery networks DNS resolver Domain Name System Google Public DNS\nShare This Post\nRelated Articles\nAlphabet\xe2\x80\x99s Jigsaw launches new app to protect users against DNS manipulation\nOctober 5, 2018\nMozilla moves its DNS over HTTPS protocol testing to Beta phase\nSeptember 17, 2018\nCloudflare launches DNS resolver 1.1.1.1 for faster and privacy-focused internet experience\nApril 2, 2018\nIt costs $715,000 to mitigate a DNS attack in 2018: EfficientIP report\nJune 13, 2018\nGoogle secures DNS traffic with DNS-over-TLS support for its public DNS\nJanuary 10, 2019\nICANN will change DNS root key next month to strengthen security of domain name system\nSeptember 20, 2018\nMany organizations unprepared for DNS attacks, reveals new global survey\nOctober 6, 2017\nGet ready to experience hyperscale enablement, cloud, data and other internet innovations at CloudFest 2019\nMarch 14, 2019\n\xe2\x80\x9cOnApp Storage Grows as the Service Provider\xe2\x80\x99s Cloud Grows\xe2\x80\x9d- Kosten Metreweli, OnApp\nMarch 8, 2013\nLeave a Reply Cancel Reply\nYour email address will not be published. Recap\nARCHIVES\n2010\n2011\n2012\nPublishers\xe2\x80\x99 Picks\nVIDEOS\nGET THE PAPER\nAdvertising\nCONTACT\nBattle Beacon Furia de Fortnite\nPosted by:\nPostmaster\nin\nEntertainment, Espa\xc3\xb1ol, Local, News, Sports\nAugust 14, 2018\n0\nEnglishEspa\xc3\xb1ol\nBattle Beacon\nPhotos by Crist\xc3\xb3bal Vivar\nFocused.\nIt was a BYOD day.\nThe acronym, short for \xe2\x80\x9cBring Your Own Device,\xe2\x80\x9d was an invitation for video game enthusiasts to select their playing device of choice \xe2\x80\x93 be it an Xbox Controller, Nintendo Switch or personal laptop \xe2\x80\x93 for a visit to the Armory Track and Field Center this past Sat., Aug. 11th.\nThe players, which included approximately 60 local youths from Catholic Charities Community Services, took part in the first-ever \xe2\x80\x9cFortnite\xc2\xa0in the\xc2\xa0Heights\xe2\x80\x9d\xc2\xa0Championship.\nReleased in 2017, Fortnite: Battle Royale is an immensely popular, multiplayer video game with over 40 million players worldwide.\nThe tournament for the online video game allowed approximately 1,000 participants to compete for a $10,000 prize pool.\nA gladiator.\nThe Armory\xe2\x80\x99s famous track was overtaken by tables housing 100 computers on the main stage, allowing competitors of various ages to battle it out for\xc2\xa0Fortnite\xc2\xa0supremacy, as the action was broadcast on the Jumbotron above.\nA DJ provided entertainment and healthy snacks were available.\nAlso present were representatives from gaming and coding enterprises.\nThough not a die-hard Fortnite fan himself, Eddie Silverio, Director of Youth Services at Catholic Charities, said the tournament offered a distinct experience.\n\xe2\x80\x9cI love that this is a day for our youth to see career opportunities in the gaming industry,\xe2\x80\x9d he noted.\nThe event was hosted by Silicon Harlem and The Armory Foundation with support from iHeartRadio and LinkNYC. Organizers billed the tournament as a \xe2\x80\x9cfamily friendly\xe2\x80\x9d event designed to combine \xe2\x80\x9cgaming, technology and health.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\xe2\x80\x9cWith more than 180,000 athlete visits each year to The Armory, many of whom are also eSports players, this will be a social competition for them,\xe2\x80\x9d said Armory Foundation Co-President Jonathan Schindel in a statement. \xe2\x80\x9cThe seating configuration and technology at The Armory are ideal for eSports, and I expect we will also convert some of the gamers into trying out track and field.\xe2\x80\x9d\nFor more information, go to\xc2\xa0www.fortniteintheheights.com.\nFocused.\nA gladiator.\nBring your own.\nGaming industry reps were present.\nCommitted to the cause.\nThere were approximately 1000 participants.\nThe tournament was broadcast on the Jumbotron.\nBattle bros.\nIn character.\nTaking the oath.\nFuria de Fortnite\nFotos por Crist\xc3\xb3bal Vivar\nTraiga el suyo.\nFue un d\xc3\xada BYOD.\nEl acr\xc3\xb3nimo, abreviatura de \xe2\x80\x9cBring Your Own Device\xe2\x80\x9d (traiga su propio dispositivo, en ingl\xc3\xa9s), fue una invitaci\xc3\xb3n para que los entusiastas de los videojuegos seleccionen su dispositivo preferido, ya sea un Xbox Controller, un Nintendo Switch o una computadora port\xc3\xa1til personal, para visitar el Centro de Pista y Campo La Armer\xc3\xada el pasado s\xc3\xa1bado 11 de agosto.\nLos jugadores, que incluyeron a aproximadamente 60 j\xc3\xb3venes locales de Servicios Comunitarios de Caridades Cat\xc3\xb3licas, participaron en el primer campeonato \xe2\x80\x9cFortnite in the Heights\xe2\x80\x9d.\nLanzado en 2017, Fortnite: Battle Royale es un videojuego de m\xc3\xbaltiples jugadores, inmensamente popular con m\xc3\xa1s de 40 millones de jugadores en todo el mundo.\nEl torneo para el videojuego en l\xc3\xadnea permiti\xc3\xb3 que aproximadamente 1,000 participantes compitieran por un pozo de premios de $10,000 d\xc3\xb3lares.\nComprometidos con la causa.\nLa famosa pista de la Armer\xc3\xada fue sobrepasada por mesas albergando 100 computadoras en el escenario principal, permitiendo a los competidores de distintas edades luchar por la supremac\xc3\xada de Fortnite, mientras la acci\xc3\xb3n era transmitida en el Jumbotron arriba.\nUn DJ proporcion\xc3\xb3 entretenimiento y hubo tentempi\xc3\xa9s saludables disponibles.\nTambi\xc3\xa9n estuvieron presentes representantes de empresas de juegos y programaci\xc3\xb3n.\nSi bien no es un ac\xc3\xa9rrimo fan de Fortnite, Eddie Silverio, director de servicios juveniles de Caridades Cat\xc3\xb3licas, dijo que el torneo ofrece una experiencia distinta.\n\xe2\x80\x9cMe encanta que esta sea un d\xc3\xada\xc2\xa0para que nuestros j\xc3\xb3venes vean oportunidades de carrera en la industria de los videojuegos\xe2\x80\x9d, se\xc3\xb1al\xc3\xb3.\nHubo aproximadamente 1000 participantes.\nEl evento fue organizado por Silicon Harlem y la Fundaci\xc3\xb3n La Armer\xc3\xada con el apoyo de iHeartRadio y LinkNYC. Los organizadores anunciaron el torneo como un evento \xe2\x80\x9cfamiliar\xe2\x80\x9d dise\xc3\xb1ado para combinar \xe2\x80\x9cjuegos, tecnolog\xc3\xada y salud\xe2\x80\x9d.\n\xe2\x80\x9cCon m\xc3\xa1s de 180,000 visitas de atletas cada a\xc3\xb1o a La Armer\xc3\xada, muchos de los cuales tambi\xc3\xa9n son jugadores de eSports, esta ser\xc3\xa1 una competencia social para ellos\xe2\x80\x9d, dijo el copresidente de la Fundaci\xc3\xb3n La Armer\xc3\xada, Jonathan Schindel, en un comunicado. \xe2\x80\x9cLa configuraci\xc3\xb3n de asientos y la tecnolog\xc3\xada en La Armer\xc3\xada son ideales para eSports y espero que tambi\xc3\xa9n convierta a algunos de los jugadores para probar el atletismo\xe2\x80\x9d.\nPara obtener m\xc3\xa1s informaci\xc3\xb3n, vaya a\xc2\xa0www.fortniteintheheights.com.\nConcentrados.\nUn gladiador.\nTraiga el suyo.\nRepresentantes de la industria de los videojuegos estuvieron presentes.\nComprometidos con la causa.\nHubo aproximadamente 1000 participantes.\nEl torneo fue transmitido en el Jumbotron.\nHermanos de batalla.\nCon vestuario especial.\nTomando el juramento.\nCommunity Entertainment Espa\xc3\xb1ol Kids Local empezando\xe2\x80\x9d\nJune 19, 2019\nThis Week\xe2\x80\x99s Issue\nFind us on Facebook\n@Manhattantimes\nAnnual summit examines issues facing Latino community\nStakeholders, elected officials & community leaders sought t\xe2\x80\xa6 https://t.co/AhKI1uwk6e 18 mins ago\nRT @Uptowncollectiv: Spread Love It\xe2\x80\x99s The Uptown Arts Stroll Way\nSummer is here & so is the Weekly Dose of
